title: Backend Engineer
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
 King operates mobile games at a massive scale. With titles like Candy Crush, Bubble Witch and Farm Heroes our code runs on hundreds of millions of devices across the world.
   

  

 We are looking for a Java Backend Developer that will take pride in creating the very best bite sized entertainment for millions of players worldwide.
   

  

 Your role within our Kingdom
   

  

 The Monetisation & Rewards area is responsible for building complex, high-scale, real-time systems, working closely with other parts of the business to support the monetisation activities for our popular games. We are looking for a backend developer with practical experience in Java, and the drive and enthusiasm to succeed in a demanding and professional team environment. Our ideal candidate will be:
   

  

* A team player who likes to discuss solutions and ideas.
* Striving to be a genius in your area of expertise.
* Build valuable tools to support the game development process


 Skills to create thrills
   

  

 You have a great passion for programming and a solid sense of quality and polish. As a developer, you are also analytical and genuinely interested in understanding the whole tech stack. You must have excellent interpersonal and communication skills and be a strong team player, able to work in a fast-paced, demanding yet fun professional environment.
   

  

* Experienced in Java, databases and web development in general.
* Used to UNIX environments.
* Strong knowledge of web protocols, application servers and web servers.
* Strong Computer Science fundamentals, design patterns and object-oriented knowledge
* Design, architect, test, document and implement features in our core services
* Deliver high-quality and well-structured code


* Used to TDD
* Familiar with HTML, CSS, Javascript, Bash


 A great saga needs all sorts of heroes
   

  

 Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply can’t expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes. And that’s it.
   

  

 We’re Seriously Playful
   

  

 Officially, we’re a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world. Unofficially, we’re a serious business that’s not afraid to have fun. Every day at King, we mix intuition with logic, art with science and magic with mathematics to create the games the world loves to play. Together with our parent company Activision Blizzard, our mission is to bring moments of magic to everyday life. If you think this is something you can help us achieve, let’s talk.
   

  

 At King, we bring moments of magic to hundreds of millions of players every day—and we’re just getting started. Join us on the journey.
   

  

**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Python Backend Senior Software Engineer - Remote 4 days a week (Europe)
description:
**About Us**
**Gr4vy (pronounced Gravy)** 
 , is a "no-code" cloud payments orchestration platform. Gr4vy’s mission is to become the platform-of-choice by which all retailers deploy payment infrastructure around the world. Founded by former PayPal fintech leaders, Gr4vy is set to disrupt the $4 Trillion global retail payment space by removing the complexity of merchants running their own payment infrastructure.
   

  

 Having both raised a total of $27.2M in funding and nearly doubling our valuation in less than a year, it’s an exciting time to join the engineering team of this innovative B2B startup. You’ll have the opportunity to build with the best in the industry while driving Gr4vy’s product marketing strategy from the ground up.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Software Engineers at Gr4vy collaborate across product, engineering, design, and other stakeholders. We work in short two week sprints & regularly share, reflect on and iterate on our work.
   

  

 Our platform uses Python and the FastAPI framework along with React and Typescript for most of our frontend. We use unit, integration and acceptance tests to drive design and keep everything working.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* You have influence over complex projects which may require coordination and collaboration with colleagues outside of your immediate team.
* You have strong communication skills, and be comfortable discussing problems and solutions with your team-mates.
* You work with the product manager to ensure that the scope is appropriate to deliver value early and often.
* You take ownership of support tasks to ensure operational stability working on any incidents proactively until they are resolved.
* You work to help define and implement necessary and useful monitoring & alerting.
* You set and improve standards across all different aspects that impact engineering.
* You mentor junior team members to help them grow and learn.
* You are a role model within the team for the company values.


**Requirements**
 We’re looking for developers with strong experience writing Python, preferably using the FastAPI framework. Experience with Starlette, asyncio, SQLAlchemy, pytest would be beneficial.
   

  

 You’ll have experience writing high-value tests and have an understanding of software design principles.
   

  

**Why you’ll love working at Gr4vy**
 You’ll be joining at a truly momentous time in our company’s life cycle. We want your imprint on how the world experiences Gr4vy as the leader in the fast-growing cloud payments space. Come and bring your skills to a growing team of 11. You’ll influence, challenge and help build our inclusive culture and passion for equity. A global identity is in Gr4vy’s DNA, with employees currently spanning Europe and the San Francisco Bay Area.
   

  

**Our Fine Print**
 We choose laughter first. Sometimes our standups veer into debates about food, family (furballs included), and unlimited lifehack fails. We’re committed to learning, to advocating, and to doing better for our customers and ourselves, every day.
   

  

**Diversity statement**
 We value all the great benefits that diversity brings and encourage everyone to bring their whole self at work, regardless of gender, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age or disability.
   

  

**Need some extra context?** 
 Read about us in this recent Crunchbase exclusive.
   

  

 Compensation: Competitive salary in USD + equity + benefits Location: Anywhere in Europe - Remote working.

title: API Developer
description:
**About Hubexo:** 




 We provide data, insights, and software solutions to the global construction industry. We specialise in project information, eTendering, product information, market intelligence, and specification. We help the world build better by delivering unrivalled insights and technology that shape places where people live, work and play.
 



  





**The role:** 




 As an API Developer for the Content Tech Tribe, you will be a key driver in our platform's evolution. Your primary purpose is to build the robust, scalable, and secure API for a new event-driven collaborative system that will replace and modernize existing legacy solutions. You will serve as a technical authority on API design, guiding frontend teams and collaborating across the organization to ensure our services are efficient, reliable, and future-proof.
 



  





**This is what you’ll be doing:** 



* Designing, developing, and maintaining scalable APIs using TypeScript and Node.js.
* Implementing a secure, reliable data access and business logic for a new collaborative system.
* Integrating APIs with external services and internal applications.
* Writing clean, maintainable, and well‑tested code.
* Collaborating with frontend engineers, product managers, and designers to deliver end‑to‑end features.
* Monitoring, debugging, and optimising API performance and reliability.



  





**About you:** 



* Strong proficiency in TypeScript, Node.js, and modern API design (REST API, Graph QL)
* Experience with relational and/or NoSQL databases.
* Familiarity with authentication, authorization, and security best practices.
* Understanding of scalable architecture, cloud services (e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP), and CI/CD pipelines.
* Strong problem‑solving skills and ability to work in a collaborative, agile team environment.
* Excellent communication and documentation skills.



  





**Why Hubexo:** 




 We’re not here to coast—we’re here to challenge, grow, and build better. For our people and for our customers. That means we’ll expect a lot from you: ownership, precision, and a drive to lead by example. In return, you’ll get the space to dream big, take smart risks, and be seen, heard, and valued.
 



  





 You’ll join a team that’s proud of what we deliver—and hungry to keep improving.

title: Senior back-end developer with GenAI experience
description:
**About Arkus AI** 




 Arkus AI is on a mission to revolutionise precision medicine through intelligent, AI-powered technologies. We are developing autonomous AI agents and a robust AI platform to support clinicians, researchers, and healthcare administrators in addressing some of the most complex challenges in medicine.
 



  





 We are looking for a
 **Senior Back-end Engineer with strong GenAI experience** 
 to help design and develop our AI agent platform. In this role, you will focus primarily on back-end systems and infrastructure while leveraging your understanding of generative AI (LLMs, agent frameworks) to enable cutting-edge healthcare applications.
 



  





**What You’ll Do**

 **core back-end infrastructure**

 for real-time agent operations

 **unit and integration tests** 
 to ensure system reliability

 in back-end or software engineering, building production-grade systems

 **back-end development** 
 with Node.js/TypeScript and Python

 **RESTful API design** 
 , SQL/NoSQL databases, and distributed systems
* Familiarity with
 **LLMs and agent frameworks** 
 (e.g., LangChain, LangGraph, AutoGPT, Semantic Kernel) and how they integrate into back-end platforms
* Experience with
 **vector databases** 
 (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Weaviate) and retrieval pipelines
* Knowledge of
 **cloud infrastructure** 
 (AWS, GCP, or Azure), containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and CI/CD pipelines

* Bonus: background in healthcare systems (FHIR, EHRs) or working in
 **regulated environments** 
 (HIPAA/GDPR)

**Why Join Arkus AI?** 



* Help
 **shape the future of AI agent platforms** 
 in healthcare
* Work on
 **cutting-edge back-end challenges** 
 at the intersection of AI and system engineering
* Be part of a
 **mission-driven, fast-moving team** 
 with real clinical impact
* Competitive salary, equity, and hybrid work flexibility



  





  





 Industry

title: Embedded Linux Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

* At least 5+ years of experience as a software developer working in Linux development environment
* Solid experience from working with secure embedded systems, eg security hardening, secure boot, cryptography, secure communication and coding practises.

* Strong experience of C++ and RobotFramework
* Source control systems experience (Git, Gitlab and/or GitHub)

**Meritorious**

 14-09-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?

title: Senior Backend Developer
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Hi, I’m Tomas Brimor, Engineering Manager for Team Enrichment & API at Telia Play. We’re looking for a
 **Backend Developer** 
 to join our team, which serves as the engine behind the consistent, complete, and lightning-fast metadata catalog that powers the Telia TV experience across the Nordics.
   

  

 If you’re passionate about designing high-performance systems, solving complex data problems, and building software that has direct impact, this is your opportunity to make a difference. Help shape the metadata systems that power Telia Play!
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Developer in Team Enrichment & API, you’ll work at the core of our metadata ecosystem. Our mission is to aggregate, normalize, enrich, and deliver metadata from a wide range of providers efficiently, accurately, and reliably. This metadata acts as a critical data layer that supports content discovery, playback, recommendations, and catalog navigation across the Telia TV platform.
   

  

**You will:**
* Design and build backend services that process and enrich metadata in near real-time
* Model and maintain metadata structures that ensure consistency and completeness
* Create APIs and event-driven systems to support metadata distribution across teams
* Optimize performance and correctness in a high-throughput, low-latency pipeline
* Collaborate with backend developers, data specialists, and other teams to innovate across the entire metadata lifecycle, from ingestion and modeling to enrichment and delivery


 Our typical tech choices include Java, Kotlin, and Spring Boot, deployed in AWS. We use SNS, SQS, and Kinesis for event-driven and message-based communication. Data is stored in PostgreSQL and DynamoDB, depending on access needs. Infrastructure is defined using Terraform, and we maintain a cloud-native workflow with CI/CD pipelines in GitHub along with strong observability practices, including metrics and dashboards in Grafana.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re a backend engineer who enjoys building scalable systems, understands the importance of data quality, and thrives in collaborative environments. You take ownership and think beyond code to improve systems as a whole.
   

  

 We’re looking for someone with:
   

  

* 5+ years of professional experience in Java/Kotlin and backend development
* Strong understanding of microservices architecture
* Hands-on experience with cloud-native services (preferably AWS), container orchestration (Kubernetes), and infrastructure as code (Terraform)
* Proficiency in designing and maintaining data processing pipelines, APIs, and system integrations
* A proactive mindset and focus on improving systems rather than simply delivering features
* Fluency in English and strong communication skills for cross-functional collaboration
* Awareness of secure software development practices (SSDLC) and commitment to quality assurance
* Experience with AI-assisted development tools like GitHub Copilot
* Bonus: hands-on experience with AI/ML including prompt engineering, embeddings, RAG, and deploying models into production systems.


**Why join us?**
 We are a core team within the Telia TV platform, and our systems are foundational to every customer-facing feature. When metadata is missing or delayed, it’s instantly visible. When it works as intended, the experience is seamless.
   

  

 You’ll join a highly skilled and collaborative team that values technical excellence, curiosity, and real-world impact. We believe in autonomy and trust, and we are always exploring how to evolve metadata processing and content discovery.
   

  

**We are more than a workplace**
 At Telia, you’ll be part of a diverse, inclusive team of over 16,500 people around the world. We are recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, and we are committed to sustainability in everything we do.
   

  

 We offer a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for hybrid work, and more. You'll also be eligible for an annual bonus based on performance and company results.
   

  

 For applicants in Lithuania only: monthly salary range for this position is up to 6400 EUR before tax.
   

  

**Ready to turn complex metadata into seamless content experiences?**
 We’d love to hear from you. Please submit your application no later than 2025-09-22 through our recruitment system. We cannot accept applications via email. Background checks will be conducted as part of the hiring process.
   

  

 If you have questions, feel free to contact me directly at tomas.brimor@teliacompany.com.
   

  

 Join us and help design the systems that shape how content is organized, connected, and delivered.

title: Sr. Software Engineer
description:
**Senior Frontend Developer – Help Shape the Future of Dairy Farming at DeLaval**
 Are you a passionate frontend developer who thrives in a collaborative, cross-functional team? Do you enjoy crafting clean, accessible, and high-quality web solutions that make a real-world impact? Join us at DeLaval and be part of the team that’s driving innovation in modern dairy farming through DeLaval Plus – our digital platform that supports farmers worldwide.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
 As a frontend developer at DeLaval, you’ll work closely with Product Owners, Project Managers, Scrum Masters, UX Designers, QA Engineers, and Backend Developers to evolve and enhance the DeLaval Plus website. You’ll be part of the full journey – from idea to production – ensuring every feature delivers value to our customers.
   

  

 You’ll play a key role in developing and continuously improving the frontend of DeLaval Plus, building user-friendly, high-performance interfaces that meet both business objectives and customer needs. You’ll ensure the frontend is reliable, accessible, and scalable — from implementing new features to refining existing ones — all while maintaining clean code and solid testing practices.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Develop and maintain the frontend of DeLaval Plus
* Collaborate daily in a cross-functional team
* Take part in design discussions, planning, development, testing, deployment, monitoring, and incident handling
* Ensure quality through automated testing, clean code, accessibility, and continuous improvement
* Work closely with customer support teams to understand and respond to real-world needs
* Continuously learn and share knowledge with the team


**Qualifications**
 We’re looking for
 **someone with at least 5 years of experience** 
 in frontend development, and who’s ready to take technical responsibility in a product-focused team.
   

  

**Tech Stack You’ll Work With**
 We’re looking for someone with hands-on experience in most (or all) of the following:
   

  

* Languages & Frameworks: TypeScript, Vue, CSS, HTML
* Testing & Quality: Cypress, Jest (unit testing), SonarQube
* Build Tools: Webpack, System.js
* Version Control & CI/CD: Git, GitLab CI/CD pipelines
* Monitoring & Observability: Grafana, Loki, Sentry, OpsGenie
* Cloud & APIs: AWS (S3), working with APIs
* Accessibility & Internationalization: WCAG, i18n
* Development Standards: Clean Code principles


**Who You Are**
 We value people who are:
   

  

* Responsible and proactive – you take ownership and drive work forward
* Communicative – you love discussing technical ideas and improving solutions together. You are fully professionally proficient in English and preferably Swedish.
* Business-aware – you’re keen to learn about our company and industry to build smarter solutions and want to work at the office in Tumba at least three days a week
* Open-minded – you’re ready to challenge and be challenged in a respectful, inclusive team
* Pragmatic – you know how to deliver value early through MVPs, while still writing clean, maintainable code that scales over time


 And yes – you’re also excited about visiting farms to better understand our customers and how our products help them every day. Thus, we also hope that you have a driver's license.
   

  

****Why DeLaval?****
 At DeLaval, we combine tradition and innovation to support dairy farmers in over 100 markets. We’re a purpose-driven company where your code directly impacts animal welfare, food quality, and sustainable farming.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely.
   

  

 Applications close on September 26. Please ensure your application is submitted before then. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us. Apply today and help us shape the future of farming — one clean, simple line of code at a time. We’re growing our team and looking for more developers! Visit our careers page to explore all open roles.
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Magnus Storbjörk, magnus.storbjork@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Agnes Edbom, agnes.edbom@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions. Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group. See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Mjukvaruingenjör till Saab!
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Brinner du för modern mjukvaruutveckling, DevOps och att skapa lösningar som gör skillnad på riktigt? Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta med avancerad teknologi, tillsammans med ett engagerat team, i en organisation där innovation och säkerhet står i centrum.*
**Din roll**
 Som
 **Senior Software Developer** 
 får du en nyckelroll i utvecklingsteamet. Du kommer att designa, bygga och förvalta våra mjukvaruutvecklingsmiljöer, miljöer som är avgörande för hela organisationens utveckling och leveranser.
   

  

 Du blir en del av ett team på sju utvecklare och arbetar med moderna teknologier som Kubernetes, containers och CI/CD-flöden. Rollen innebär att du både fördjupar dig tekniskt, driver förbättringar och påverkar hur vi bygger framtidens plattformar. Samtidigt som du delar med dig av din kunskap och stödjer kollegor, vilket ger både ansvar och möjlighet att utvecklas tillsammans med teamet.
   

  

 Din profil
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har en teknisk högskoleutbildning och flera års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling. Du har goda kunskaper inom:
   

  

* Linux och containerteknologier (t.ex. Docker, Podman)
* Databaser och CI/CD-flöden
* Versionshantering (Git)
* Programmering i exempelvis Python eller Bash
* Agila arbetssätt, planering i Jira och vana att arbeta i DevOps-miljöer


 Det är meriterande om du även har erfarenhet av DevSecOps, molnplattformar eller API-utveckling.
   

  

**Vi tror att du är:**
* Självdriven och nyfiken på ny teknik.
* En lagspelare som gärna delar kunskap och coachar andra.
* Kommunikativ, problemlösande och kundfokuserad.


**Övrigt**
 Tjänsten kan innebära visst resande.
   

  

 Du behöver godkännas enligt gällande säkerhetsskyddsbestämmelser, vilket i vissa fall kan innebära krav på svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

**Vad du blir en del av**
 Upptäck oändliga möjligheter. Anta utmaningar, skapa smarta innovationer och uppgradera dina förmågor. Det här är en plats för kluriga tänkare, modiga pionjärer och alla däremellan. Tillsammans uppnår vi det extraordinära, var och en tar med sitt unika perspektiv. Varje bidrag räknas.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Med 26 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem.
   

  

 Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga.

title: Business Developer Master Data Management
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are seeking a senior Business Developer with solid experience in Master Data Management (MDM) to drive adoption, governance, and data quality across the organization. The role involves leading initiatives to onboard new data domains, developing and executing MDM strategies and roadmaps, and promoting the business value of master data through training, workshops, and stakeholder engagement. You will also contribute to the establishment of frameworks and processes, support procurement activities, and evaluate new technologies such as AI and knowledge graphs to strengthen MDM practices.
   

  

 This role requires proven leadership in MDM implementations, experience in long-term governance and data quality initiatives, and strong communication skills to engage senior management. Curiosity for new technology and the ability to bridge business needs with technical opportunities are key to success.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 Drive initiatives to onboard new domains and entities into the MDM platform.
   

  

 Contribute to the development execution of MDM strategies and roadmaps aligned with business needs.
   

  

 Promote the business value of master data management, data quality and governance through workshops, training, and stakeholder engagement.
   

  

 Contribute to the development of frameworks and processes for master data management.
   

  

 Stay up to date with emerging technologies (e.g. AI, knowledge graphs) and assess their potential within the MDM landscape.
   

  

 Support procurement processes and contribute to vendor evaluations where needed.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 Proven senior experience in leading Master Data Management (MDM) implementations, with a demonstrated ability to drive adoption and onboard new data domains over time.
   

  

 Experience in establishing long-term data governance and data quality efforts within an organization.
   

  

 Experience in managing procurement processes.
   

  

**Experience In Defining And Establishing New Roles And Responsibilities.**
 Higher education, preferably at university level. Ideally within data science or engineering.
   

  

**Other skills that are needed for the role:**
 Ability to effectively communicate the importance of MDM, data governance, and data quality to senior management.
   

  

 An interest and curiosity in exploring technical opportunities that can be leveraged in MDM solutions, such as knowledge graphs, AI, and similar technologies.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 We are a cross-functional and forward-thinking team passionate about turning data into business value. We embrace innovative solutions and strive to stay at the forefront of new technologies and methods within Information Management. Ensuring FAIR data and premium data quality is more important than ever — not only to unlock the value of our digital investments and data-driven solutions, but also to secure efficiency and reliability in our operational flows. Our work spans across Scania’s global organization and extends into the wider TRATON Group, where we actively contribute to shaping the data agenda. Collaboration, curiosity, and continuous learning are at the heart of how we work — always with the goal of making a real and lasting impact.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-09-15. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Nordquist Helen, Group Manager, helen.nordquist@scania.com
   

  

 A background check for this position will be done.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Data Modeler
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Financial Services, and Banking
description:

title: Senior Lowcode Developer
description:
**About Hubexo:** 




 We provide data, insights, and software solutions to the global construction industry. We specialise in project information, eTendering, product information, market intelligence, and specification. We help the world build better by delivering unrivalled insights and technology that shape places where people live, work and play.
 



  





**The role:** 




 As a Senior Lowcode Developer, you will be a key driver in enhancing our company's operational efficiency. Your primary purpose is to lead the design and development of our core workflow and collaboration systems, leveraging the Mendix low-code platform to build intuitive, powerful, and seamlessly integrated applications. You will serve as a technical authority on Mendix development, guiding UI/UX designers, mentoring other developers, and collaborating across the organization to deliver solutions that are global, scalable, secure, and perfectly aligned with the needs of our internal teams.
 



  





**This is what you’ll be doing:** 



* Lead the end-to-end design and development of intuitive applications on the Mendix low-code platform.
* Develop custom modules, widgets, and logic using microflows to support complex internal operations and enhance user interactions.
* Collaborate closely with UX/UI designers to translate wireframes and mockups into functional, responsive, and visually appealing user interfaces.
* Architect and implement robust integrations with existing internal systems and services using APIs, ensuring seamless data flow and functionality.
* Champion application performance, scalability, and security, implementing best practices and conducting rigorous code and logic reviews.
* Mentor other developers by reviewing application logic, microflows, and custom components, fostering a culture of high-quality development.
* Create and maintain comprehensive technical documentation, contributing to the establishment of our Mendix development standards and best practices.
* Actively engage with stakeholders, product owners, and internal system owners to align on requirements and ensure seamless cross-team integration.



  





**About you:** 



* Deep understanding of the Mendix platform, including domain modeling, microflows, and application architecture.
* Proven experience integrating Mendix applications with other systems using REST APIs and web services.
* Proficiency with frontend web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) for custom styling and functionality.
* Experience designing and advising on domain models that support complex application logic and integration requirements.
* Strong problem‑solving skills and ability to work in a collaborative, agile team environment.
* Excellent communication and documentation skills.



  





**Why Hubexo:** 




  





 We’re not here to coast—we’re here to challenge, grow, and build better. For our people and for our customers. That means we’ll expect a lot from you: ownership, precision, and a drive to lead by example. In return, you’ll get the space to dream big, take smart risks, and be seen, heard, and valued.
 



 You’ll join a team that’s proud of what we deliver—and hungry to keep improving.

title: Senior Mobile Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU WILL DO:**
 As a Senior Software Engineer - Mobile in the organization you will be in the center of the action where both design and product meet business. You will be working closely with Product Managers, Engineering Managers, all product teams, iOS and Android community. You should have a strong technical background, a passion for developing SDKs, mobile application development, and a drive to deliver bug-free developer and user experiences as per the business requirement without compromising on the industry best coding practices. We are looking for highly skilled and experienced for the role of Senior Software Engineer - Mobile to lead the development team of our internal tools. As an Mobile Developer, you will be responsible for designing and delivering robust and scalable solutions. You will also provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to junior members in the iOS and Android community.
   

  

**Team Description**
 The Experimentation and Visual Analytics team is dedicated to the creation of advanced internal tools designed for analyzing various test variations and interpreting data effectively. This team plays a pivotal role in collaborating with all product teams across H&M, ensuring that they develop and implement the most optimized solutions for launching new features. By leveraging data-driven insights, they aim to enhance the overall efficiency and effectiveness of feature releases, ultimately contributing to H&M’s commitment to innovation and excellence in customer experience.
   

  

**You will:**
* Lead the end-to-end development of complex native and multiplatform solutions, from concept to development including testing, distribution and writing documentation.
* Drive technical decision-making, provide architectural guidance, and ensure the implementation of best practices.
* Collaborate closely with iOS and Android community, cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and backend developers, to define requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
* Develop scalable and maintainable libraries, ensuring adherence to coding best practices, design patterns, and architectural guidelines.
* Provide technical guidance and mentor junior iOS and Android developers, reviewing their PRs and providing constructive feedback.
* Perform thorough code reviews to ensure code quality, performance, and adherence to established coding standards.
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of UI components and iOS/Android applications through thorough testing, debugging, and optimization. Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues and performance bottlenecks.
* Collaborate with other teams to understand and guide developers.
* Define test plans and ensure comprehensive test coverage.
* Drive innovation by researching and implementing cutting-edge technologies.
* Stay up to date with the latest trends and advancements in mobile development, evaluate new tools and frameworks, and promote their adoption when appropriate. Also, share knowledge and best practices with the iOS and Android community.
* Participate in architectural discussions, providing insights and proposing solutions to enhance system architecture and overall product quality.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of development processes and workflows.
* Participate in Agile/Scrum development processes, contribute to sprint planning, and provide accurate estimations for project timelines.
* Collaborate with Security and Compliance teams to ensure that mobile solutions adhere to internal policies and industry regulations.
* Contribute to CI/CD pipelines and automation strategies to improve development workflows and reduce manual efforts.


**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with..*
* 6+ years of experience in mobile development (Android and/or iOS).
* Hands-on experience with Kotlin Multiplatform (KMP) for shared codebases
* Strong proficiency in Kotlin for Android and Multiplatform module development.
* Proficiency in Swift, Objective-C and Kotlin for iOS and Android application and SDK integration.
* Familiarity with Jetpack Compose and SwiftUI.
* Experience in building and publishing mobile SDKs/libraries for internal or external use.
* Deep understanding of platform-specific architecture and constraints (Android/iOS).
* Experience with unit testing, integration testing, and UI testing in both platforms.
* Familiarity with KMP testing strategies including using expect/actual declarations.
* Comfortable with debugging native iOS and Android issues within shared and platform-specific code.
* Experience with modular architecture, clean code principles, and design patterns like MVVM.
* Strong understanding of dependency injection, coroutines/flows, and asynchronous programming.
* Ability to collaborate closely with cross-functional teams (iOS, Android, backend, product).
* Comfortable contributing to API design, versioning, and developer experience for SDKs.
* Familiarity with tools such as GitHub Actions for CI/CD in mobile projects.
* Experience working in Agile/Scrum team, actively participating in ceremonies and contributing to continuous delivery
* Proven experience in leading cross-platform mobile teams or initiatives, especially in contexts involving KMP or shared codebases. Experience with mobile analytics tools (e.g., Firebase or similar) and feature flagging/experimentation frameworks.


**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Lead Developer
description:
*Ungefär 10 % av Sveriges befolkning bor i en HSB-förvaltad lägenhet och nu behöver vi hjälp att utveckla framtidens digitala tjänster. Vill du vara med och forma det framtida HSB* 
 ?
 *Vi söker en Lead Developer som vill vara med och ta oss till nästa teknologiska nivå för att förbättra vardagen för HSBs medarbetare, boende och bostadsrättsföreningar.* 









  





***Vi söker en engagerad Lead Developer***




  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Lead Developer är du med bygger upp den teknologiska förmåga HSB behöver för att erbjuda de bästa användarupplevelserna i allt från digitala styrelsemöten till smarta hus och betalningstjänster. Du arbetar tillsammans med utvecklingsteamen i att leverera stabila, säkra och värdeskapande digitala tjänster. Du är teknisk mentor för kollegor och driver tekniska strategier och vägval för våra tjänster och lösningar.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Du har arbetat i mer än 10 år som systemutvecklare och vet att de bästa lösningarna uppstår när teknikval och arkitektur grundas i verkliga behov, och du vill bygga system som är både smarta och hållbara över tid.
 



  





 Du hamnar ofta i situationer där du hjälper till att koppla ihop vision med verklighet – och trivs i den rollen. Samtidigt vill du inte släppa kodandet, utan tycker om att vara hands-on och bidra praktiskt till utvecklingen. Du gillar att lösa komplexa problem och har en instinkt för att se vad som fungerar i praktiken.
 



  





 Det här är ingen chefsroll med personalansvar och administration – men du förväntas kunna inspirera andra och vara en mentor. Du delar gärna din kunskap och trivs i en miljö där man löser problem tillsammans. Som person är du nyfiken, social och förtroendeingivande. Du är flytande i svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift.
 



  





**Du behärskar** 




 · C#,
 



 · Azure
 



 · DevOps.
 



 · Du har arbetat med molntjänster, mikrotjänstarkitektur, Kubernetes och byggt REST\_API:er
 



  





**HSB Affärsstöd** 




 Vårt uppdrag är att utveckla och förvalta IT-stöd i syfte att skapa nytta och värde för anställda, kunder och medlemmar. Vi ansvarar för utvecklingen av HSBs digitala tjänsteutbud samt drift och förvaltning av gemensamma IT-lösningar. Verksamheten bedrivs agilt enligt SAFe-ramverket och vi har idag ca 50 medarbetare samt ungefär lika många konsulter sysselsatta. Teamet du kommer ha din hemvist i heter Tech & Arkitektur och är ett litet team med spjutspetskompetens inom teknik och arkitektur som stöttar strategiskt viktiga förflyttningar.
 



  





**Vad HSB erbjuder** 




 Placering på vårt nya moderna kontor i Hagastaden, Norra stationsgatan 93, Stockholm med bland annat tillgång till gemensamt gym och cykelgarage med tillhörande omklädningsrum. HSB erbjuder bra villkor och generöst friskvårdsbidrag.
 



  





 HSB strävar hela tiden efter att utvecklas, både som organisation och som arbetsplats, och det vi gör vi när medarbetarna utvecklas. Hos HSB är det du som påverkar din utveckling. Med den rätta ambitionen och stark drivkraft är en anställning inom HSB en bra investering i din karriär. Organisationen präglas av kärnvärderingarna Engagemang, Trygghet, Hållbarhet, Omtanke och Samverkan. Du får också stor frihet under ansvar i arbetet och HSB försöker att hjälpa dig att skapa balans i tillvaron mellan jobb och fritid. Genom att bidra till organisationens framgång kommer dina insatser att värdesättas. Möjligheterna finns hos HSB.
 



  





*Intervjuer kommer att ske löpande, så skicka din ansökan redan nu!* 




*I denna rekrytering samarbetar HSB med Mia Wretborn-Hedberg och Fanni Orestav på Active Search. För att du som kandidat skall få bästa möjliga kandidatupplevelse, ber vi dig ödmjukt att söka tjänsten i ett första steg så kommer ansvarig rekryterare ta kontakt med dig om du har en matchande profil för tjänsten. Alla ansökningar och kontakter behandlas konfidentiellt. Active Search får inte längre ta emot eller hantera ansökningar som inkommer via mejl då detta strider mot direktiven i GDPR.* 




  





*För att din ansökan ska behandlas måste du skicka in din ansökan via Ansök här i annonsen. Om du har frågor eller funderingar om tjänsten, tveka inte att kontakta Mia på telefon: 070 - 727 35 00 eller mia@active-search.se eller Fanni på 073 - 852 79 63 eller fanni@activ* 
 e-search.se

title: Account Solution Engineer - Mulesoft
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Sales
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 Salesforce is the #1 AI CRM, where humans with agents drive customer success together. Here, ambition meets action. Tech meets trust. And innovation isn’t a buzzword — it’s a way of life. The world of work as we know it is changing and we're looking for Trailblazers who are passionate about bettering business and the world through AI, driving innovation, and keeping Salesforce's core values at the heart of it all.
   

  

 Ready to level-up your career at the company leading workforce transformation in the agentic era? You’re in the right place! Agentforce is the future of AI, and you are the future of Salesforce.
   

  

* Salesforce is hiring for a Solutions Engineer within MuleSoft to join our Pre-Sales Solution Engineering team, which plays a pivotal role in driving MuleSoft's growth. As a Pre-Sales Solution Engineer, you will serve as a technical sales partner to our sales teams, aligning our solutions with our customers' visions. The MuleSoft Sales team will lean on your technical and product expertise throughout the sales cycle to formulate the sales strategy. You will be a vital contributor to the success of both our customers and Account Executives by conducting technical discovery, qualification, reframing, challenging the status quo, delivering product demonstrations and Proof of Concepts, facilitating technical workshops, and offering architectural recommendations.


 In the role of a customer trusted advisor, you will bridge the gap between the technical solution and the desired business outcomes for the customer. You will take ownership of solution reliability and be the conduit for ensuring the customer's needs are met.
   

  

**What You Get Working For MuleSoft Solution Engineering Sweden**
* Working in a passionate Pre-Sales Solution Engineering team that puts teamwork first
* Leaders who really care about your development and success
* Working for a company that truly lives its core values Equality and Sustainability
* Working for one of the most innovative companies worldwide


**Qualifications You’ll Need To Be Successful**
* Excellent presentation and composure abilities in front of technical and non-technical key stakeholders
* Skills to establish trust with clients, and the ability to influence key decision makers
* Solid oral, written, presentation, collaboration and interpersonal communication skills
* Ability to work as part of a team to solve technical problems in alignment with the sales strategy
* Degree in IT / Business Informatics or equivalent relevant experience required
* Hands-on Java development experience and ability to code and debug against Java APIs is preferred
* Experience with cloud technologies - iPaaS, SaaS applications, Automation solutions, cloud infrastructure, IA is preferred
* Experience building and delivering Proofs of Concept (PoCs) and responding to functional & technical elements of RFIs/RFPs independently
* A passion for technology and an ability to translate that passion to impact business for our customers
* Ability to travel as needed
* Languages: English + Swedish are essential
* Minimum of 4 years of professional experience
* Experience will be evaluated based on alignment to the core competencies for the role (e.g. extracurricular leadership roles, military experience, volunteer work, etc.)


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Salesforce and/or MuleSoft Certifications
* Previous experience as a solution/sales engineer for a Software company in similar technologies (Integration, APIM, Automation, CRM, Analytics,...)


**What You’ll Achieve**
* 3 months:
+ Learn MuleSoft Anypoint Platform and get certified in MuleSoft’s Developer Trainings
+ Complete MuleSoft’s Kickstart sales training
+ Begin to build your architecture reframe and whiteboarding skills through shadowing and customer-scenario role playing
+ Create a Self Service Asset on a MuleSoft technical topic of interest

* 12 months:
+ Become certified in all Product, Architecture, and Sales Messaging trainings
+ Execute Architectural Workshops/Engagements, PoCs, and demos with our Partners
+ Enabling partners on technical and architectural elements of the MuleSoft platform
+ Mentoring, assisting, and enabling partners through Pre-Sales Engagements
+ Guide our strategic Partner Technologists, Client Leads, Practice Leads, Vertical BU leads, CTOs, Engineers, and Consultants through MuleSoft Point of View
+ Create and execute high impact Technical/Architectural presentations and top notch programs/workshops/demos, for Partner Technical and Architectural enablement
+ Respond to functional and technical elements of RFIs/RFPs
+ Partner with the Channel Teams and the sales reps in the partner on account planning and strategy and support marketing with evangelism activities (writing blogs, participating in demo-driven webinars, speaking at industry events, etc.)


****Benefits & Perks****
 Check out our benefits site which explains our various benefits, including well-being reimbursement, generous parental leave, adoption assistance, fertility benefits, and more
   

  

 Unleash Your Potential
   

  

 When you join Salesforce, you’ll be limitless in all areas of your life. Our benefits and resources support you to find balance and
 *be your best* 
 , and our AI agents accelerate your impact so you can
 *do your best* 
 . Together, we’ll bring the power of Agentforce to organizations of all sizes and deliver amazing experiences that customers love. Apply today to not only shape the future — but to redefine what’s possible — for yourself, for AI, and the world.
   

  

 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Senior Data Platform Engineer
description:
Do you want to work in a global company where you can contribute to a more sustainable food production? DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less.
   

  

 DeLaval is now looking for a Senior Data Platform Engineer to join our Data Platform Team. This team is a part of Digital Services Unit of DeLaval.
   

  

 The Digital Services Unit leads DeLaval’s transition to offer cloud-based services to bring unique value to dairy farmers, dealers, partners, and its own organisation. We are on an exciting journey of connecting farms to the cloud. Through data collection in combination with machine learning, we can create new and innovative solutions helping the dairy farmers all around the world.
   

  

**Purpose Of Role And Key Responsibilities**
 As a Platform Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining a scalable, secure, and cost-efficient data platform on AWS. You will work closely with data engineers, data scientists, and product teams to enable the development of Data and AI products. Your focus will be on infrastructure, automation, and platform capabilities that support both technical and non-technical users
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Build and maintain a self-serve data platform using AWS services, Terraform, and Kubernetes
* Implement and manage data mesh principles to support domain-oriented data ownership
* Design and support medallion architecture (bronze, silver, gold layers) using Databricks
* Develop and orchestrate data pipelines using Apache Airflow
* Implement data governance practices including cataloguing, lineage, and access control


**Required Qualifications And Experience**
* Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, information systems, engineering, or equivalent
* Experience working in agile/scrum delivery teams
* Experience with Airflow deployment on AWS EKS.
* Experience with deploying Databricks in AWS
* Strong hands-on experience with AWS services (e.g., S3, Glue, Lambda, IAM, EKS, Redshift), with the last 5 years working with AWS Cloud Infrastructure
* Experience of working with multi account cloud infrastructure.
* Proficiency in Terraform, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), CICD
* Understanding of Data Lakehouse and Medallion architecture
* Familiarity with Kubernetes setup and operations
* Knowledge of Data Mesh concepts and implementation
* Programming skills in Python
* Strong communication and collaboration skills


**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviours. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours, Set Direction, Make things happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We Offer You a Workplace Like No Other, Where State-of-the-art Technology Goes Hand In Hand With Animal Welfare. DeLaval Is a Part Of The Tetra Laval Group Together With Tetra Pak And Sidel. In Addition, We Offer
   

  

* Market-based salary with an individual incentive program based on performance and company result
* A secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance, parental leave, reduction of working hours)
* Parental leave compensation
* Wellness contribution of 4 000 SEK/year
* Private health insurance
* Flexible working hours and a hybrid working policy that allows employees to work from home in agreement with their manager
* 30 days paid vacation


 This position is located in Tumba, Sweden. You will report to Jedrzej Siemienski, Manager Software Development.
   

  

**Application**
 To apply for this position, you must send in your application through the DeLaval career page: Careers - DeLaval. Kindly note that we do not accept applications via email. The last day to apply is 30/09/2025. This position may be filled before the end of the application period.
   

  

 If you have questions regarding the position or the recruitment process, please contact Jedrzej Siemienski, Hiring Manager (jedrzej.siemienski@delaval.com) or Agnes Edbom, Recruiter (agnes.edbom@delaval.com)
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions. Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,700 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at  www.corporate.delaval.com

title: Business Architect - Automotive
description:
**🚀 Join VIPAS AB as a Business Architect - Automotive, Södertälje🚀**
**Are you ready to thrive in the dynamic world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB is on the lookout for passionate, driven professionals to join our growing team and take on exciting new projects across Sweden.**
 🌟 About VIPAS AB
   

  

 At VIPAS AB, we believe technology should empower businesses—not complicate them. We’re an IT consulting company that delivers smart, scalable, and tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java, Python, and Cloud platforms. Our expertise spans: Software Development, DevOps & Automation, Embedded Systems, Manufacturing Enginering, Mechanical Enginering, Android & Mobile Solutions, Project Management & Engineering and so on.
   

  

 We’re not just consultants—we’re strategic partners guiding organizations through digital transformation with confidence and clarity.
   

  

 💼 Your Role
   

  

 As a Consultant at VIPAS AB, you’ll work on the Industrial ERP Backbone (IEB – Industrial ERP Backbone) program is driving a transformation of the global industrial ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) landscape. Within this initiative, the Order-to-Cash (O2C) process is a key area of focus under the Sales & Marketing domain. To support this effort, we are seeking an experienced consultant to join the Business Architecture team. This role is fully dedicated to the IEB program (100% allocation) and involves close collaboration with program stakeholders to ensure end-to-end consistency across the O2C process, alignment with other IEB streams, and adherence to the target architecture.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Represent and safeguard the O2C and Order-to-Delivery (O2D) processes within the IEB program from both process and architectural perspectives.
* Ensure alignment with business objectives and target architecture, guiding design decisions toward efficiency, scalability, and best practices.
* Act as a pragmatic, results-driven partner to the implementation project manager.
* Support Business Process Owners (BPOs) in defining, documenting, and governing global processes and templates.
* Manage change requests related to O2C and facilitate change management activities. Collaborate across process streams and with the Service Integrator to ensure seamless integration.
* Identify and communicate business impacts when aligning processes with industry standards.


**Your Profile:**
* Documented experience in the Order-to-Delivery domain within the manufacturing industry; experience with automotive or complex products is a plus.
* Strong background in business architecture across global and complex environments.
* Pragmatic and results-oriented approach to problem-solving.
* Skilled in stakeholder communication, collaboration, and cross-functional alignment.
* Proficient in process documentation and tools (Aris is currently used).
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written.


 🌟 Why VIPAS AB?
   

  

 At VIPAS AB, we don’t just offer jobs—we build careers. Here’s why top IT professionals choose us:
   

  

* 📄 Secure & Transparent Employment We follow the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement, ensuring fair compensation, benefits, and long-term stability.
* 🌍 Diverse Industry Exposure Work on high-impact projects across Telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking, gaining experience that spans multiple sectors.
* 🚀 Accelerated Career Growth Whether you're a seasoned developer or an emerging tech leader, we offer continuous learning, challenging assignments, and leadership opportunities to help you grow fast and grow smart.
* 🤝 Culture of Collaboration & Curiosity Join a team that values innovation, inclusion, and integrity. At VIPAS, your ideas matter, your voice is heard, and your growth is celebrated.


 📬 How to Apply
   

  

 Ready to make an impact? Send your
 **resume and cover letter** 
 to
 **xxxx@vipas.se** 
 . We review applications continuously—so don’t wait!
   

  

 ⚠️
 **Note** 
 :
 **Only candidates with Sweden PR/citizenship or a valid work permit will be considered.**
 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. So if a role speaks to you, apply immediately!

title: Webbutvecklare
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care and Government Administration
description:
Är du en erfaren webbutvecklare med både analytisk förmåga och helhetssyn? Drivs du av att göra nytta och att påverka samhället på riktigt? Då kan det här vara en roll för dig.
   

  

****Om tjänsten****
 Du ingår i ett tvärfunktionellt agilt team tillsammans med utvecklare, designers och produktägare som löpande levererar värde. Teamet jobbar med plattformsutveckling och ansvarar för vårt designsystem. Vi vill förena design och teknik genom att implementera smarta lösningar i både kod, prototypverktyg och som dokumentation. Målet är att skapa enhetlighet och tydlighet i allt vi bygger på myndigheten.
   

  

 Du arbetar nära dina kollegor och har även flera kontaktytor med övriga organisationen. Designsystemet är under uppbyggnad och du får möjlighet att sätta stor prägel på arbetet framåt. Plattformstjänsterna vi bygger skapar värde för resten av organisationen och i förlängningen för Sveriges medborgare.
   

  

****Om dig****
 Vi söker dig som förstår vikten av god arkitektur och kvalitet och kan se till produktens hela livscykel. Du trivs när du får samarbeta och kommunicera på jobbet, både i teamet och med kollegor i andra delar av organisationen. Det är en självklarhet för dig att ta ansvar och driva ditt eget arbete framåt. Vi ser även att du har en god analytisk förmåga och gillar att lösa problem samtidigt som du har en helhetssyn som präglar hela ditt arbete.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* minst fem års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom webbutveckling
* flerårig erfarenhet av JavaScript/TypeScript, Node.js och ramverk som exempelvis Vue
* erfarenhet av att implementera tillgängliga webblösningar enligt WCAG
* god kunskap i svenska, både i tal och skrift.


**Det är meriterande för tjänsten om du har:**
* erfarenhet av arbete med plattformsutveckling och webbarkitektur
* erfarenhet inom webbsäkerhet, testautomatisering och optimering av prestanda
* erfarenhet av monorepon och verktyg som Lerna
* erfarenhet av projekt med kontinuerlig integration och leverans (CI/CD)
* erfarenhet av arbete med öppen källkod.


****Vad erbjuder vi?****
 Vi är en myndighet i tillväxt. E-hälsomyndigheten erbjuder dig att vara med och skapa samhällsnytta. Vi arbetar med stora transaktionskritiska system som påverkar samhället, till exempel e-recept och Läkemedelskollen.
   

  

 Hos oss kommer du att omges av trevliga och kompetenta arbetskamrater, på en myndighet med ett flertal viktiga samhällsuppdrag.
   

  

 På E-hälsomyndigheten har alla medarbetare förtroendearbetstid och möjlighet att arbeta delvis på distans. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss: Jobba hos oss
   

  

****Är du intresserad?****
 Frågor angående tjänsten besvaras av enhetschef Per Sjögren, 010-458 6276.
   

  

 Frågor angående rekryteringsprocessen besvaras av hr-specialist Dorothea Lockman, 010-175 3741.
   

  

 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan och cv via vårt rekryteringsverktyg senast den 30 september. Ladda gärna upp examensbevis, betyg och intyg som är relevanta för tjänsten i samband med din ansökan.
   

  

 Anställningen är tillsvidare med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Placeringsort för anställningen är Kalmar eller Stockholm. Arbetet kan innebära tjänsteresor, främst mellan Kalmar och Stockholm.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. Därför kan vi komma att behöva genomföra en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585). För en del arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 Om du har beslut om skyddade personuppgifter, kontakta den HR-specialist som finns namngiven i annonsen.
   

  

****Om E-hälsomyndigheten****
 E-hälsomyndigheten driver utvecklingen av den nationella digitala infrastrukturen inom hälsa, vård och omsorg. Vi skapar förutsättningar för digitala tjänster och lösningar för privatpersoner och professioner inom hälso- och sjukvård, apotek och socialtjänst. Vi arbetar för att hälsodata ska bli tillgängliga i hela vårdkedjan, oavsett var individer får vård.
   

  

 Hos oss arbetar cirka 500 medarbetare fördelat på två orter, Kalmar och Stockholm. Läs mer om oss på www.ehalsomyndigheten.se
   

  

 Rekryteringen sköts av E-hälsomyndighetens HR-enhet och vi undanber oss säljsamtal från rekryteringsföretag och annonssäljare.

title: IT-arkitekt/Systemutvecklare
description:
Bakgrund
   

  

 Vi söker en mycket erfaren och självgående IT-arkitekt/systemutvecklare till ett flerårigt program inom en större myndighet. Rollen är central i ett komplext systemutvecklingsinitiativ med flera parallella team och successiva releaser. Arbetet bedrivs huvudsakligen på plats i Sundsvall, och sker enligt agila arbetssätt som Scrum och skalad Scrum.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Leda och genomföra arkitekturutredningar samt ta fram lösningsförslag för nya och befintliga system.
* Etablera och vidareutveckla lösningsmönster i linje med myndighetens referensarkitektur.
* Skapa och uppdatera utvecklingsriktlinjer, handböcker och tekniska policys.
* Modellera processer och flöden (BPMN) och säkerställa spårbarhet från behov till lösning.
* Bidra operativt i systemutveckling, inklusive kodgranskning och kodrättning.
* Arbeta i och mellan flera miljöer/plattformar, såsom:
+ Camunda Modeler/Camunda
+ Java
+ Angular
+ JavaScript/TypeScript
+ OpenShift

* Samarbeta nära produkt-/uppdragsledning, utvecklingsteam och andra arkitektroller för att möjliggöra en sammanhållen leverans i skalad Scrum.
* Vara ett avancerat stöd och mentor till både interna och externa utvecklare och IT-arkitekter.


**Skallkrav**
* Minst 10 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av systemutveckling, varav minst 5 år som IT-/lösningsarkitekt i större utvecklingsinitiativ.
* Erfarenhet av att ta fram arkitekturutredningar, lösningsförslag och lösningsmönster i enlighet med referensarkitektur.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Java samt erfarenhet av JavaScript/TypeScript.
* Erfarenhet av Angular i större applikationer.
* Erfarenhet av Camunda och BPMN-baserad processmodellering.
* Erfarenhet av containerplattformar, gärna OpenShift.
* Vana att arbeta i agila miljöer med Scrum och skalad Scrum.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av kodgranskning, kvalitetssäkring och förbättring av utvecklingspraxis.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och leda andra kompetenser inom uppdraget.
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka sig på svenska i både tal och skrift.
* Möjlighet att arbeta på plats i Sundsvall största delen av tiden och utföra uppdraget från Sverige.


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet från offentlig sektor eller andra reglerade verksamheter.
* Erfarenhet från fleråriga program med omfattande releaseplanering.
* Kunskap om och erfarenhet av skalningsramverk, t.ex. SAFe.
* Erfarenhet av att ta fram utvecklingsriktlinjer/handböcker och driva efterlevnad.
* Kunskap om CI/CD, DevOps och säker utveckling i container-/Kubernetesmiljö.
* Erfarenhet av domäner som rör utbildning, studiestöd eller andra välfärdsområden.


**Personliga egenskaper**
* Självgående, drivande och lösningsorienterad.
* Pedagogisk och prestigelös mentor med förmåga att kontinuerligt överföra kunskap.
* God samarbetsförmåga och kommunikativt lugn i komplexa situationer.
* Strukturerad med fokus på kvalitet, nytta och leverans.


**Om uppdraget**
**Start:** 
 Tidigast 2025-10-15 och senast 2025-11-14 (enligt överenskommelse)
   

  

**Slutdatum:** 
 2027-12-31 (med möjlighet till förlängning till 2028-12-31)
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 100% (cirka 40 timmar/vecka, justeras för röda dagar och semester)
   

  

**Plats:** 
 På plats i Sundsvall (delvis distansarbete kan vara möjligt enligt överenskommelse; uppdraget utförs från Sverige)

title: .NET Utvecklare
description:
**Att jobba som**
 Kundhandlingar är ett område som utvecklas snabbt i vår transformationsresa och möjliggör för Skandias hantering och utskick av såväl digitala som fysiska kundhandlingar.
   

  

 Teamet arbetar främst inom backend med en blandning av förvaltning och nyutveckling. Vi använder tekniker som .NET8, NServicebus, SQL, React/typescript. Inom rollen förväntas du även lära dig att genomföra uppgifter i dokumentmallssystemet Metaforce.
   

  

 Skandia jobbar enligt metodiken Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) för att kunna leverera smarta lösningar och applikationer med hög effektivitet och kvalitet till sina kunder.
   

  

 Ditt närmaste team består av utvecklare, mjukvaruarkitekt, testare, scrum master, systemansvarig och produktägare. Vi arbetar enligt SAFe-ramverket och främjar kompetensutveckling genom mobb- och parprogrammering, Innovationsdagar och Hackathons.
   

  

 Vi sitter alla i Stockholm och arbetar hybrid, vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. Du kommer i rollen att rapportera till gruppchef inom IT Koncern- & dokument.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Vi tror att du är en analytisk problemlösare med en förmåga att se helheten samt förstå verksamhetens behov. Du har ett intresse för att sätta dig in i ny teknik, nya miljöer, nya sammanhang för att sedan använda detta för att kontinuerligt förbättra arbetssättet framåt. Du har god kommunikativ förmåga i svenska och engelska med en god förmåga att på ett pedagogiskt sätt beskriva lösningar för utvecklare, arkitekter och övriga intressenter inom Skandia.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har några års erfarenhet backendutveckling inom .NET. Samtidigt har du en god förståelse för SAFe. Du kan kommunicera på svenska flytande både i tal och skrift
   

  

* .Net
* Meriterande om du har kunskap inom NServiceBus, RabbitMQ, React/typescript.
* Meriterande om du har erfarenhet av bank eller försäkring


**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Rina Rosengren Bouius på Rina.Rosengren.Bouius@skandia.se
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner Jennie Åkerlund på jennie.akerlund@skandia.se
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Placeringsort Stockholm.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Systemutvecklare BI – med fokus på SQL och datadriven vård
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
Vill du vara med och utveckla lösningar som gör verklig skillnad i människors liv? Hos oss på CompuGroup Medical (CGM) får du möjlighet att jobba i hjärtat av svensk e-hälsa, tillsammans med engagerade kollegor och avancerad teknik. Just nu söker vi en systemutvecklare inom BI till vårt utvecklingsteam för TakeCare – ett av Sveriges mest använda vårdinformationssystem.
 



  





**Om TakeCare** 




 TakeCare är ett ledande journal- och vårdinformationssystem som anpassats för den svenska hälso- och sjukvårdens behov. Med över 60 000 användare och fler än 4,3 miljoner journaler är TakeCare en av de största vårdinformationsinstallationerna i världen. Systemet är skapat för att ge en sammanhängande bild av patientens status och vårdhistorik, stödja patientsäkerhet, användarvänlighet, och flexibilitet, samt underlätta vårdprofessionens arbete genom att frigöra tid för patientnära vårdarbete.
 



  





 Vi vidareutvecklar och förbättrar ständigt vår produkt och behöver nu stärka vårt team med en skicklig SQL-utvecklare med intresse för datadrivna lösningar.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Systemutvecklare BI kommer du att vara en nyckelspelare i vårt utvecklingsteam, där du arbetar med att utveckla och optimera databaser, integrationer och rapportlösningar kopplade till TakeCare. Ditt fokus ligger på effektiv databehandling och rapportering med hjälp av verktyg som Microsoft SQL Server, SSIS och SSRS.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som gillar att grotta ner dig i stora datamängder, optimera SQL-kod och skapa smarta lösningar som förenklar vardagen för vårdpersonal.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 



* Utveckla, felsöka och optimera SQL-lösningar för stora och komplexa datamängder.
* Designa och implementera ETL-flöden i SSIS.
* Skapa och underhålla rapporter i SSRS.
* Arbeta nära verksamhetsanalytiker och utvecklare för att förstå behov och omsätta dem i tekniska lösningar.
* Delta i kravanalys och teknisk design av nya funktioner.



  





**Vi söker dig som har:** 



* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av utveckling i Microsoft SQL Server.
* Djup kunskap i SQL och förmåga att skriva komplexa och prestandaeffektiva frågor.
* God förståelse för databasdesign och datamodellering.
* Förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i nära samarbete med andra.
* Förmåga att kommunicera obehindrat på svenska i tal och skrift – all dokumentation sker på svenska.



  





**Meriterande erfarenhet:** 



* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med SSIS för att bygga och hantera ETL-processer.
* Erfarenhet av att skapa och hantera rapporter med SSRS.
* Versionshantering i GIT.
* Visual Studio och C#.
* SFTP-skript, integrationer med REST API:er.
* Arbete enligt agila metoder (Scrum), gärna med verktyg som Jira och Teams.
* Kännedom om journalsystem, särskilt TakeCare och dess SQL-databas
 *Intelligence,* 
 är meriterande.



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




 Hos oss får du möjlighet att jobba tillsammans med ett engagerat team där alla arbetar mot samma mål – att bidra till en bättre och mer effektiv vård. Vi erbjuder dig:
 


* Komplexa och utmanande arbetsuppgifter
* Möjligheten att påverka framtidens sjukvård
* En arbetsplats i ljusa och moderna lokaler i Solna
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag och en friskvårdstimme i veckan
* Möjlighet till distansarbete två dagar i veckan
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning, heltid
* Kollektivavtal



  





**Ansökan** 




 Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse. Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterare Karin Bogren på karin.bogren@partner.cgm.com.
 



  





**Vår rekryteringsprocess** 




 Första steget är ett kortare videosamtal med vår rekryterare där vi berättar mer om tjänsten och lär känna dig bättre. Därefter följer intervjuer med din framtida chef och kollegor, samt ett kodtest eller en teknisk intervju där du får visa upp din tekniska kompetens.
 



  





 Om du går vidare till slutskedet av processen kommer vi att be om referenser samt genomföra en bakgrundskontroll innan vi erbjuder dig en anställning.
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig!
 



  





  





*CGMs vision ”Synchronizing healthcare” genomsyrar allt vårt arbete. Vi är marknadsledande leverantör av IT-lösningar och kommunikationstjänster inom hälso- och sjukvård, social omsorg, företagshälsovård, barn – och elevhälsovård samt kliniska laboratorium i Sverige. Vår drivkraft är att göra nytta för patienten via våra e-hälsolösningar. Behovet av nya lösningar är under ständig utveckling, vilket ställer höga krav på oss som leverantör. Tillsammans med våra kunder är vi starkt engagerade i att förverkliga Sveriges e-hälsovision om att bli bäst i världen på att använda digitaliseringens och e-hälsans möjligheter.*

*CGMs vision ”Synchronizing healthcare” genomsyrar allt vårt arbete.
