title: Product Manager - Growth
description:
**About Mindler** 




 Mindler was founded in 2018 by two psychologists and a doctor with a shared vision of creating a world with improved mental health. Thanks to our dedicated tech teams, who developed our app and iCBT modules, Mindler has emerged as a leading provider, transforming the mental health industry. Mindler is more than just a workplace—we combine scientific methods with human empathy to create an environment where emotions matter.
 



  





 Our tech organization is split into three teams: Growth, Treatment and Operational Efficiency. All teams work full-stack across our different applications like the patient app, psychologist web platform and back office systems. In this role you would be working with the Growth team, primarily focusing on improving our user journey and product-led growth.
 



  





**The role:** 




 As Product Manager at Mindler, you’ll report to the VP of Product and ensure that your assigned product area is proceeding efficiently and is aligned with the company's operational and strategic goals. You will work to identify and fill product gaps and drive product development that ensures company growth from a user-centered perspective. You will be part of both the Product team and the Growth tech team.
 



  





 As a PM for the Growth team you will be responsible for driving initiatives focused on Product-led Growth collaborating closely with marketing, tech and the rest of the product team.
 



  





**What you’ll be doing:** 



* Lead product development and growth initiatives, owning the KPIs that define your team’s success.
* Continuously analyze the user journeys to remove friction points and create an intuitive and supportive user experience.
* Collaborate with designers, developers, and marketing to turn ideas into user stories and technical requirements.
* Run a data-informed, iterative process to identify problems, validate solutions, and discover new growth opportunities through experimentation.
* Translate direct user insights into actionable improvements that enhance both product value and growth.
* Continuously engage and communicate in cross-departmental teams with key stakeholders to systematically identify and gather business objectives.
* Work with the product team to translate long-term vision into short-term goals, driving progress in the field of mental health.
* Ensure product features are aligned with internal guidelines and mandatory regulatory requirements(patient safety, ISO-27001, etc.).
* Champion a data-informed culture across product and tech, ensuring decisions are evidence-based and measurable.



  





**Who are you?** 




 We are looking for someone with 3+ years of experience in product or project management, who combines a strong drive and a result-oriented approach with an ability to create structure and clarity in their work. You are naturally curious, eager to stay up to date with industry trends, and skilled at translating these insights into your daily work.
 



  





**We think you’ll be a good fit if:** 



* You have a growth mindset and get excited about the challenge of using the product as an engine for growth.
* Are comfortable working with product analytics to identify pain points and opportunities within the user journey.
* Have a natural empathy for users and a proven ability to put yourself in their shoes.
* A track record of shipping product improvements that moved key business metrics.
* You have a deep understanding of UX principles with experience in creating intuitive, beautiful and effective product experiences.



  





 An undergraduate degree in a relevant field such as business, engineering, or product development is preferred. Strong communication skills are also essential, and you express yourself fluently in English, both in writing and speech as English is the main language used at Mindler.
 



  





**It’s a plus if you have:** 



* Experience in a startup or scale-up environment.
* Experience creating high-fidelity designs as well as mockups, prototypes, and visual specifications.
* Experience working on both web and app user journeys.
* Experience with digital health products or medtech.
* Experience leading large-scale web-based projects.



  





**What can we offer?** 




 If you thrive on collaborating with talented colleagues in the office, but also appreciate the flexibility to work remotely, we could be a great match. We offer a diverse role that emphasizes work-life balance, including tech-driven social activities to foster creativity and innovation. For example we arrange hack weeks, table tennis tournaments, board game nights, etc. There are also parties and physical well-being activities together with the rest of the organization.
 



 You’ll be surrounded by inspiring colleagues in a dynamic, forward-thinking environment. This gives you the opportunity to contribute to a company on a mission to make a meaningful impact on the global market of improving digital mental healthcare.
 



  





**We are looking forward to hearing from you!** 




  





**What the process will look like:** 




 👋 Video call with a recruiter to learn more about you – and tell you more about us!
 



 ✨ interview with Hiring Manager
 



 📝 Case
 



 🚀 Case presentation & interview with potential team members
 



*–-* 




*Mindler is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation or age.*

title: Visual Designer
description:
At intric we believe everyone should be able to benefit from AI. That’s why we’re on a mission to build an easy, open and secure AI platform, enabling the public sector and enterprises that value data sovereignty to focus on what’s really important: Creating positive impact and lasting change.
   

  

 We’re at the forefront of enabling wide-scale, organisation-level AI adoption without technical barriers, crafting delightful and powerful interfaces that make novel technologies intuitive. You’ll join us on our journey as the company’s second designer, laying a foundation for our future design culture and organisation.
   

  

 We are ambitious and deeply engaged, united by the drive to break down barriers to AI adoption. You’ll become part of a collaborative, Stockholm-based team where every idea is valued and every voice shapes the product.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Set a new standard of how AI-assisted work looks for everyone, not just tech experts.
* Work across the full creative spectrum, from product to brand and marketing
* Learn and grow fast, with opportunities to contribute in new spaces you might not have tackled before.
* See your work shipped and used by organizations committed to meaningful public impact.


**What you’ll get:**
* Flexible, trust-based work environment
* Rapid career development in an exciting, fast-moving sector.
* Competitive compensation package combining salary and stock options


**How we work:**
* Cross-functional and highly collaborative: Work closely with great minds from business, engineering, and product.
* No hand-offs, full ownership: Pair up from ideation through launch.
* Flat and open: The best ideas win, and everyone has real influence.
* Fast iterations: Lightweight process, pragmatic decisions, and continuous learning.
* Culture of purpose: We are focused on impact.


**What we’re looking for:**
* Creative, independent first-principle thinkers: you invent, not imitate
* How you take ideas from nothing all the way to launch
* You hold the highest bar for quality and champion great user experiences
* Refined taste and exceptional visual expression
* Strong digital intuition—you know the possibilities and constraints of modern mediums
* Formal training in design or comparable professional experience


*Bonus points for*
* Coding skills
* Experience in a product company, startup, or agency—especially in tech or the public sector


**Note** 
 : we welcome all applications demonstrating relevant creative work, especially work spanning multiple disciplines.
   

  

 Apply via this form and include a portfolio showcasing your best work.
   

  

 Applications without a portfolio will not be considered.

title: AI Expert
description:
**Are you passionate about deploying AI at scale and shaping the digital future?
   

  

 Join us in a strategic role where you'll architect and scale advanced AI solutions that go beyond prototypes — driving real-world transformation across customer experience and operational efficiency.**
**About The Team**
 Telenor Sweden is scaling its AI ambitions through the newly launched AI Center of Acceleration, and we are looking for an AI Expert to the Analytics Architecture & AI Automation Team who thrives at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and business impact.
   

  

 This role is ideal for someone who can identify business pain points and translate them into AI-powered solutions, leveraging a bleeding-edge tech stack to drive innovation. You will work hands-on with GCP Vertex AI, AI agents and other modern data platforms to help business teams explore, experiment, and adopt AI in meaningful ways.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 In this role, you will collaborate with various departments across Telenor Sweden to identify challenges and design AI solutions that address real-world problems using advanced tools and techniques. You will develop prototypes and proof-of-concepts to demonstrate the feasibility and potential of AI, providing stakeholders with a clear understanding of what is possible.
   

  

 A key part of your work will involve creating scalable AI and ML pipelines, as well as agent-based solutions, utilizing technologies such as Google Agent Development Kit and Vertex AI. This enables rapid experimentation and quick deployment of AI capabilities across the organization. You will build ML solutions using Python, PyTorch, and Hugging Face, while also gaining hands-on experience working in cloud environments (GCP), containers, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
   

  

 Additionally, you will contribute to the development and maintenance of responsible AI practices and governance frameworks, ensuring that the use of AI technology aligns with ethical standards and promotes sustainable innovation.
   

  

**What Is In It For You**
 Step into a strategic role where you’ll be at the forefront of AI adoption across Telenor Sweden. This is your chance to work on solutions that move beyond the lab—deployed in production and driving real impact for customers and internal operations alike. You’ll have direct influence on how AI reshapes digital experiences, all while collaborating in a forward-thinking environment backed by global expertise. And with continuous learning through Telenor Academy and dedicated training programs, your growth won’t just be encouraged—it’ll be expected.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for you with the following skills:
   

  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience.
* Strong programming skills in Python (at least 5+ years of experience); familiarity with Java or JavaScript is a plus.
* Concepts around RAG architecture and governance
* Experience with GCP, especially Vertex AI, and ideally AWS. (at least 2+ years of experience)
* Interest in LLMs (e.g., ChatGPT, Gemini, Anthropic), AI agents, and searchable AI.
* Familiarity with data visualization, API integration, and MLOps.
* A proactive mindset with strong problem-solving skills and a focus on user experience.
* Excellent communication skills primarily in English. Swedish is a plus.


**Apply today!** 
  

  

 Will you take the next step in your career with us? We look forward to your application! We review applicants on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait—reach out today.  Last application date is 30th of September 2025.
   

  

 If you have any questions or want to know more, feel free to contact the hiring manager adeel.anwar@telenor.se. Please note that we cannot accept applications via email.
   

  

**Our promise to you** 
  

  

**We are better together.** 
  

  

 Here, you’ll be part of a family-like and inclusive culture, built on strong shared values and leadership that empowers you with both trust and confidence. We believe in enabling each other to act and make decisions, while always having each other’s backs through ups and downs.
   

  

**We support relationships and societies.** 
  

  

 Telenor plays a vital role in the society, giving your work a greater purpose. Every day, we create value for millions of people and maintain a customer-first approach where human relationships are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**We make room for life.** 
  

  

 Work from home up to two days a week, if your role allows it. The rest of the time, we create magic together at the office. You also get two ‘give-me-a-break’ days per year for extra time off, and our flexible working hours help you balance your time. We support you through every stage of life with our benefit package, including collective agreements, occupational pensions, wellness allowances, and customized insurance solutions tailored to your needs.
   

  

**We invite you to a career in motion.** 
  

  

 Your development is at the center of our culture. We dedicate at least 40 hours per year for you to deepen your expertise, explore new areas, and develop in your role. Through Telenor Academy and other learning initiatives, you’ll have the tools and freedom to advance your career. If you want to broaden your horizons, we are present throughout the Nordics.
   

  

**Good to know** 
  

  

 As part of Telenor’s policy, we conduct background checks on final candidates for all recruitments.
   

  

 Looking for a workplace for the future? A workplace where you own your career and you can make the most of your expertise and opportunities. Where you can contribute to technical innovations that we can barely imagine today, but we know will change the map of how people communicate with each other and live their connected lives. Are you looking for a workplace where what happens between people makes all the difference? Then you are welcome at Telenor.

title: PhD student in Human-Computer Interaction and AI-supported creative programming
emails: preben@dsv.su.se, verhagen@dsv.su.se, studierektorF@dsv.su.se, st@st.su.se, st@st.su.se, saco@saco.su.se, saco@saco.su.se, seko@seko.su.se, seko@seko.su.se
description:
**The Department of Computer and Systems Sciences.** 
 With over 200 employees and 4,500 students, the Department of Computer and Systems Sciences (DSV) is a strong and dynamic research and educational environment. The discipline of computer and systems sciences bridges the gap between technology and the humanities, social sciences, and behavioral sciences, with great relevance to our lives today and in the future. Our research addresses how new information and communication technology should be designed to benefit people, organizations and entire societies.
   

  

 DSV offers a stimulating research community in an international environment. As a doctoral student at DSV, you study together with many other doctoral students, collaborate with senior research colleagues and get connected to other researchers in Sweden and abroad. DSV’s current location is Stockholm University's campus in Kista, north of central Stockholm, and we will move to the main Frescati campus within a couple of years.
   

  

 More information about us, please visit: the Department of Computer and Systems Sciences.
   

  

 Project description
   

  

 You will conduct research in human-computer interaction, with a focus on design and creative programming (combing programming and creating interactive digital artefacts). Artificial intelligence (AI) is increasingly shaping how we approach interaction design and creative programming. So far, this AI integration has mainly focused on text- and screen-based applications, but as AI moves beyond the screen, new opportunities and challenges arise in designing for embodied and multimodal interaction in design and creative programming. Interactive artefacts, such as embodied and social robots (agents) open up possibilities for richer, more diverse forms of engagement. This shift raises critical questions about how we design and program when AI expands into new modalities of interaction.
   

  

 This PhD project aims to explore how multi-modal AI-based design and creative programming practices can extend into the domains of social robotics and embodied interaction. In particular, the project will investigate how social robots and embodied artefacts can act as co-creators alongside humans, supporting new approaches to interaction design and creative programming. The research will also consider contexts where interactions involve not only individual users and single AI tools, but also networks of humans and multiple AI-enabled tools and agents working together.
   

  

 The project will involve both designing and building working prototypes, as well as conducting design-oriented empirical studies in varied contexts of use. The goal is to advance both theoretical and practical understandings of how creative programming and interaction design can expand into embodied forms of interaction, in particular, through the use of robots and physical artefacts.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive salary and wellness benefits, you will receive strong support for your academic development, including funding for books, conference travel, and professional growth opportunities. You will join an interdisciplinary research environment with access to state-of-the-art facilities, international networks, collaborative projects, and mentoring throughout your PhD journey.
   

  

 Qualification requirements
   

  

 In order to be admitted to postgraduate education, the applicant must have the general and specific entry requirements. The qualification requirements must be met by the deadline for applications.
   

  

 You meet
 **general entry requirements** 
 if you have completed a second-cycle degree, or completed courses equivalent to at least 240 higher education credits, of which 60 credits must be in the second cycle, or have otherwise acquired equivalent knowledge in Sweden or elsewhere.
   

  

**Specific entry requirements** 
 are described in the general syllabus for doctoral studies in the field of Computer and Systems Sciences and state that the applicant must have completed courses at second- cycle level in Computer and Systems Sciences with a minimum of 60 higher education credits, or equivalent, including a thesis with a minimum of 15 higher education credits. In addition, the applicant is required to have English language skills equivalent of Common European Framework of Reference for Languages Level B2.
   

  

 Selection
   

  

 The selection among the eligible candidates will be based on their capacity to benefit from the training. The following criteria will be used to assess this capacity:
   

  

* Independence in the analysis and organization of the earlier work
* Problem formulation and rigor in previous work and in the research plan
* Previously shown ability to keep the specified time limits
* Methodological and scientific maturity
* Communication and cooperation skills
* Subject specific knowledge relevant to education.


 Admission Regulations for Doctoral Studies at Stockholm University.
   

  

**About The Employment**
 We offer a fixed-term employment as a doctoral student according to Chapter 5 of the Higher Education Ordinance (1993:100). The period of employment may not be longer than what corresponds to full-time doctoral education for four years. As a doctoral student, you should primarily devote yourself to your own doctoral education, but the employment may include work with education, research and administration to a limited extent (maximum 20 %).
   

  

 A new employment as a doctoral student is for a maximum of one year, the employment is then renewed for a maximum of two years at a time.
   

  

 Stockholm University strives to be a workplace free from discrimination and with equal opportunities for all.
   

  

 Contact
   

  

 For more information, please contact Associate Professor Preben Hansen, preben@dsv.su.se, and Professor Harko Verhagen, verhagen@dsv.su.se, or Director of PhD studies, Åsa Smedberg, studierektorF@dsv.su.se.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Apply for the PhD student position at Stockholm University's recruitment system. Attach a personal letter and CV as well as the attachments requested in the application form. It is the responsibility of the applicant to ensure that the application is complete in accordance with the instructions in the job advertisement, and that it is submitted before the deadline. We recommend that the application, with associated documents, be written in English.
   

  

 The instructions for applicants are available at: How to apply for a position.
   

  

 Stockholm University contributes to the development of sustainable democratic society through knowledge, enlightenment and the pursuit of truth.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 % | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: SU FV-3225-25 | Facklig företrädare: ST/OFR st@st.su.se, ST/OFR st@st.su.se, Saco-S saco@saco.su.se, Saco-S saco@saco.su.se, Seko seko@seko.su.se, Seko seko@seko.su.se, | Publicerat: 2025-09-09 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-10-15

title: Product Manager - Financial Products
description:
**Juni who? 👋**
 At Juni, we’re busy building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.
   

  

**How & Why We Do It 🚀**
 We give our people the same thing we’re building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what’s more – make the most of it. We truly believe we’re making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.
   

  

**Your role at a glance 🤸‍♀️**
 You'll work closely with designers, engineers, specialist stakeholders, and the Product director to develop Banking capabilities and financial products, which form a core part of our platform and value proposition. You will act as the voice of our customers and be a stable bridge between engineering and the business. You will also help the team function as an empowered product team by setting the right product culture and vision, and help the team deliver high quality impactful features.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities 👏**
 In this role, you’ll:
   

  

* Product Strategy and Vision: Defining the strategic direction of financial products, aligning them with the company's overall business strategy. This involves creating product roadmaps that outline planned features and enhancements based on customer feedback, competitors, market demands and business priorities.
* Customer Experience: Lead the vision for financial experience within the platform- bank transfer, invoice payment, credit usage etc. Ensure the financial and banking features are chain-linked into cohesive end-to-end workflows. Work with designers to build UX that WoWs customers.
* Financial Product Ecosystem: Unpacking the Swedish banking ecosystem and liaising with regulators, Swedish banks and payment third parties, to unlock new payment rails and banking partnerships. This would require you to attend events, conferences and build a strong network in the payment eco-system. The same will need to be replicated for our other GTM geographies.
* Customer Research: Conduct thorough customer research to understand customer (ICP) needs, market trends, and the competitive landscape in the financial product space. This includes gathering insights through customer interviews, surveys, and data analysis.
* Cross-functional collaboration: Working closely with various departments such as engineering, design, commercial, and finance to ensure effective product development and launch. This includes facilitating communication and alignment among different teams.
* Product Development Oversight: Managing the product backlog, prioritizing features, and working closely with development teams to ensure timely and high-quality delivery of banking products
* Market Positioning and training: Developing strategies for positioning and pricing banking and financial products in the market. Ensuring that the commercial teams have been trained on product features and value propositions clearly understood by all.


**Within 1 Month You Will**
* Understand how Juni’s product teams work
* Be integrated with your team
* Ship your first financial features 🚢


**Within 3 Months You Will Have**
* Stronghold of your teams' growth metrics
* Deep understanding of your team’s roadmap
* Shipped many features and fix critical bugs 🐛


**Within 6 Months You Will**
* Oversee delivery against your metrics and roadmap (with some bumps along the way)
* Set 12-month rolling vision for Banking and Finprod domain
* Actively participate in customer research to understand the voice of customer
* Understand how Juni’s product teams work
* Be integrated with your team
* Ship your first financial features 🚢


**Tooling ⚙️**
* Slack
* G-suite
* Notion
* BI tools


**Qualifications 👑**
 What we need to see
   

  

* Familiarity with fintech and financial services (preferably from Sweden)
* Good understanding of Swedish and global payment eco-system
* 3+ years of product manager experience
* Understanding of payment rails


 What we’d love to see
   

  

* Familiarity with financial and spend management products (preferably from Sweden)
* 5+ years of overall experience
* Experience with Bankgiro, Rix-inst, Swift, any other payment rails
* Engineering or computer science degree


**Your people 👥**
 Our team is as ambitious as our amazing customers. We aim high and we move with speed to make our vision a reality. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn’t get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.
   

  

**Your Benefits 😍**
 We’re freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.
   

  

* We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg at least two days per week.
* Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
* Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
* Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
* Stock options. We can’t promise you’ll make a fortune. But we’ll give it our very best shot.
* Vacation days. 30 days contractually. Unlimited in policy. Awesome.
* Private Health insurance. You know. Just in case
* Beautiful offices in central Gothenburg and Stockholm, front row sea view!


 At Juni, we’re building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.

title: Senior ASIC Design Lead in Lund/Stockholm:
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Are you ready to create the 5G future? Predicting the future is fun. Inventing it is powerful. We do both.
   

  

 5G is here, and Ericsson is the early leader in bringing it to market. With the first commercial launch of 5G in 2018, there’s never been a better time for you to make your mark. The possibilities are endless across industries – from automotive and transport to agriculture, utilities, and more. Ericsson is investing heavily in the future 5G technology where leading-edge ASIC and FPGA development is key.
   

  

 We are looking for a new member to our Digital Development Team within ASIC organization in Lund, Sweden. You will be leading a team working on Digital Design and Verification of ASIC System-on-chip specific IP design units as well as taking on own Design Developments in the same area. You will work in a team who is long-term responsible for the evolution of specific IP and sub-systems and you will be defining the roadmap looking 2-3 years forward.
   

  

 The position requires very good leadership skills, experience in especially digital design but knowledge in modern verification techniques are valued. You need to have the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Our organization works in accordance to Agile principles where close team interaction is central.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Design lead for a cross functional team
* Be responsible for Definition of ASIC System-on-chip (SoC) specific IP blocks and subsystems
* Support design team during development, verification and validation of the design
* Take full responsibility for design, being block or sub-system
* Break-down Requirements and create Architecture and Design Specifications
* Perform Digital Design, and run all RTL sign-off checks
* Review Verification and Design plans and specifications produced by other team members
* Populate Product Backlog, and prioritize work for yourself and team members
* Continuously improve and optimize ways of working
* Generate appropriate documentation


**Skills you bring:**
* Over 8 years of experience in ASIC design, verification, and advanced SoC development, with strong proficiency in System Verilog and AMBA-based designs.
* Hands-on experience with Cadence and Synopsys design suites, SpyGlass for IP sign-off, and formal verification methodologies.
* Proven technical leadership and a strong track record of cross-team and cross-site cooperation in delivering high-quality outcomes..
* Commitment to quality-conscious design methodologies, with a focus on reliability and compliance.
* Master’s Degree or PhD in Electronic Engineering, providing a robust foundation for innovative problem-solving.


**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 [[Sweden]] || [[Stockholm/ Lund]]
   

  

**Primary Recruiter:** 
 [[Anitha Pulluru]]
   

  

**Hiring Manager:** 
 [[Pierre Rhodin]]

title: Store Assistant till Name it Hede
description:
**Nu söker vi en butikssäljare till Name it Hede!**


Motiveras du av att ge service i världsklass? Är nöjda kunder och goda resultat starka drivkrafter för dig? Då är den här tjänsten för dig!


Name it är en del av modebolaget BESTSELLER som fokuserar på kläder och mode för våra yngsta. Name it är idag etablerat i över 20 marknader världen över – inklusive Europa, Asien, Nordamerika, Sydamerika och Australien – och riktar sig till barn i åldrarna 0–16 år.


Nu söker vi en driven säljare som vill vara i utvecklingen av vår Nameit butik på Hede Fashion Outlet i Kungsbacka. I rollen som säljare har du en nyckelposition för att säkerställa våra kunders upplevelse av Nameit samt driva resultat och en positiv utveckling av butiken.

**Vem är du?**  

Vi söker er som fyllt 18 år och gärna med erfarenhet av detaljhandel, en positiv person med god känsla för service och försäljning. Du drivs av att utvecklas och vill ständigt uppnå bättre resultat.

**I rollen som säljare:**


Din primära uppgift är att ge våra kunder en förstklassig upplevelse i form av service och butiksupplevelse. Du kommer att arbeta med följande i butiken:

* Försäljning, kundupplevelse och kundservice.
* Lager, uppackning av varor och påfyllning av varor i butik.

**Du kommer att passa hos oss om du:**

* Fokuserar på försäljning och gillar att skapa en fantastisk kundupplevelse.
* Är serviceinriktad och vet hur man skapar en attraktiv butik.
* Har några års erfarenhet från detaljhandeln och ett stort modeintresse.

**Anställningsform**  

Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på 10 timmar/veckan med start 1 oktober 2025, eller enligt överenskommelse. Vi tillämpar provanställning.

**Ansökan**  

Låter detta intressant? Skicka då in din ansökan och personligt brev via ansökningsknappen nedan redan idag! Vi kommer att börja med rekryteringen omgående så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt men som senast 2025-09-23. Vänligen notera att vi tyvärr inte har möjlighet att ta emot ansökningar via mail/post. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

**ABOUT NAME IT**  

*For more than 30 years, NAME IT has been encouraged by children’s straightforwardness and energy. We see the world through the eyes of children and our creativity is rooted in their loving and free spirit.*  

*At NAME IT we design clothes which allow children to express their own personality. We are proud to have a selection that features a full range of kids clothing from underwear to outerwear, always with a particular focus on our core products; jeans and outerwear. In every piece of clothing, functionality, safety, quality and responsibility are our main priorities. Brands within NAME IT: NAME IT, LMTD and Lil’ Atelier. NAME IT is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. Visit www.nameit.com or* *www.bestseller.com**.*

title: Backend Engineer - Payments Domain
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**


We’re looking for experienced Backend Engineers to join our Payments Domain, the team responsible for secure and seamless money flows in and out of our platform. From integrating global payment providers to meeting new regulatory requirements and improving transaction approval rates, Payments is central to the LeoVegas gaming experience.


You’ll work on Rhino, our multi-brand platform built on 230+ microservices, handling millions of transactions every day. The role covers the full development lifecycle: design, implementation, deployment, monitoring, and continuous improvement.

 **YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR**

* Designing, building, and maintaining backend services in a microservice architecture
* Developing high-performance solutions for payment processing and high-frequency transactions
* Improving platform reliability, scalability, and approval rates for transactions
* Owning services end-to-end, from requirements to production monitoring
* Contributing to architectural decisions and technical discussions
* Collaborating with developers, domain architects, product owners, and other stakeholders

 **OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE**


ESSENTIAL SKILLS

* 5+ years’ experience with Java and Spring Boot
* Experience with MySQL and Kafka
* Experience with microservices in high-traffic systems
* Ownership mindset: you design, build, and deliver complete solutions
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills (in English), capable of articulating technical decisions and offering valuable recommendations to the team
* Clear communication in English (C1 level)


NICE TO HAVE

* Experience with Kotlin
* Background in payments or financial applications

 **WHO WE ARE**


At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the iGaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.

 **BENEFITS*** Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.

 **JOIN US!**In our pride, we like to empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait around for things to happen. We pounce and make it happen!  

Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar! **\*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\***

title: IT Change & Release Manager
description:
**IT Change & Release Manager**


New York | US | UK & Europe  



  

**Who We Are**


SiriusPoint is a global insurance and reinsurance company created from the merger of Third Point Re and Sirius International Insurance Group. We are a top global (re)insurer writing a worldwide portfolio of businesses including Accident & Health, Liability, Property and Specialty.


Bermuda-headquartered and listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: SPNT), we are looking at ways to grow intelligently, underwrite profitably, and drive technology innovation in the insurance industry.


We challenge convention, disrupt the traditional way of doing things, and devise new and better solutions. We strive to be excellent in everything we do, and we always strive to continuously build knowledge and learn beyond our current skillsets.  

  

**Join Our Team**

We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented IT Change & Release Manager with a strong foundation in the insurance industry to coordinate IT change and release activities across Agile and DevOps environments. This role ensures the secure and compliant delivery of IT changes and software releases while minimizing disruption to operations. You’ll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams and report directly to the Head of IT Strategic Projects and Governance.

**Key Responsibilities**

**Change & Release Execution**

* Develop and manage change and release strategies tailored to (re)insurance systems and regulatory requirements.
* Maintain a centralized release calendar to ensure alignment with sprint schedules, backlog priorities, and business needs.
* Facilitate CAB (Change Advisory Board) meetings to review change requests, ensure stakeholder alignment and support Agile release trains or CI/CD pipelines.
* Own, evolve and demonstrate compliance with SiriusPoint’s Change Management Policy.

**Agile Delivery Collaboration**

* Integrate change and release processes into delivery frameworks, covering both waterfall and Agile processes
* Participate in sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives to assess change impacts and ensure QA objectives are met.
* Collaborate with Product Owners, Scrum Masters, Business Analysts and QA Engineers to support continuous delivery and stakeholder alignment.

**DevOps Enablement**

* Ensure releases are orchestrated via CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Azure DevOps) with automated quality gates and rollback mechanisms.
* Monitor implementation performance using observability tools to evaluate risk, control effectiveness, and compliance.
* Partner with DevOps engineers to embed release governance into development workflows with auditable tracking and automated change control.

**Risk & Compliance**

* Conduct impact assessments and ensure all changes follow approved processes with appropriate documentation.
* Ensure compliance with regulations (e.g., HIPAA, SOX, NAIC, GDPR) and internal audit requirements.
* Own IT SOX quarterly/year-end certifications and post-release evaluations across development and infrastructure teams.

**Continuous Improvement**

* Analyze release metrics and feedback to evolve change governance and reduce deployment friction.
* Promote best practices in quality assurance and agile delivery, championing a DevSecOps mindset across teams.

**United** **B****ehind** **C****ommon** **G****oals**


At SiriusPoint we work as one team across our global business, and we unite that team behind common goals, understanding the positive impact we can all make. We aim to retain and attract great people, knowing they can achieve a rewarding and enriching career at SiriusPoint.

**Our Purpose** is to provide security and resilience in an uncertain world.

**Our** **Vision** is to be recognized as a best-in-class insurer and reinsurer, utilizing deep risk capabilities to protect our customers. Blending our talent, expertise and data to provide intelligent risk solutions.

**Our culture** is one ofperformance and accountability. Our people are our experts, and you will be empowered to apply your expertise in a supportive, collaborative and purposeful environment.

**Our Values** are at the heart of our business, and which guide everyday actions and decision making.


* Integrity: Integrity, respect and trust are our core principles
* Customer Focused: Our customers are the reason we exist
* Solution Driven: Creating solutions is our mindset
* Diversity: Diversity, inclusion and allyship make us stronger
* Collaboration: Collaboration drives outperformance

 **Be Yourself**


We are building a differentiated culture and approach. We have shared values that drive our behavior and a culture that makes it a fun, exciting, and productive place to work and a great partner to do business with. You should be entrepreneurial, pioneering, open and yourself.


This role is ideal for a proactive and detail-oriented professional who is passionate about development, governance and controls. If you thrive in a dynamic environment and are committed to maintaining high standards of IT control, this position offers a rewarding opportunity to make a significant impact.


Your skills and abilities should include:

**Required Qualifications:**

* 7+ years of experience in IT Change and Release Management.
* Strong understanding of insurance domain processes (e.g., claims, underwriting, policy administration).
* Experience with ITIL framework and change management tools (e.g., ServiceNow, BMC Remedy).
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and Azure DevOps practices.
* Excellent communication, coordination, and stakeholder management skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Strong understanding of Agile/Scrum methodologies.
* Experience working within an evolving environment and can adapt to changes in the project or schedule.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Knowledge of regulatory compliance in insurance (e.g., NAIC, GDPR).
* Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Business, or related field.

 **We Achieve More Together**


We value and support the unique voices, backgrounds, lifestyles, and contributions of a diverse global employee base that contributes to our culture every day. Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEI&B) is imperative to our success.


We are building an environment that embeds DEI&B into everything we do and enables us to unlock critical drivers of equality, innovation, and success. We want everyone to be included, valued, respected, and supported to unleash their full potential.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Job Description**  

Do you want to shape how customer data drives strategic decisions across some of the most forward-thinking fashion brands?  

At Portfolio Brands Central, you’ll be part of a small and agile team building the data foundation that powers customer growth. You’ll work hands-on with modern cloud technologies while influencing how data is used to personalize experiences, optimize marketing, and support business development across COS, Weekday, &Other Stories and ARKET.


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES


As a Data Engineer, you will:

* Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and integrated data products across multiple brands.
* Develop and optimize data flows using Google Cloud Platform (GCP), ensuring secure and efficient data movement.
* Collaborate with CRM and marketing teams to enable personalized customer journeys and insights.
* Support the migration and enhancement of existing solutions, including real-time data integrations.
* Take ownership of data governance, security, and compliance within your solutions.
* Contribute to the strategic foundation of our data architecture and help shape how we grow with customer data.


WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH


You’ll be part of a small and collaborative data team, working at the heart of our customer growth agenda. In this role, you’ll collaborate closely with CRM and Marketing stakeholders from COS, Weekday, & Other Stories and ARKET, as well as tech specialists across the H&M Group. Together, we build scalable and secure data solutions that support all Portfolio Brands, enabling smarter decisions and more personalized customer experiences.

 **Qualifications**  

We are looking for people with…

* Experience in building data pipelines and working with cloud platforms (GCP preferred).
* Proficiency in Python and/or Java.
* Solid knowledge of SQL and data modeling techniques.
* Experience with Terraform and dbt.
* Familiarity with CI/CD principles and DevOps mindset.
* Understanding of data governance and security best practices.


And people who are…

* Curious and proactive, with a passion for data and problem-solving.
* Strong communicator who can explain technical concepts in a simple way.
* Collaborative and inclusive, thriving in cross-functional teams.
* Strategic thinker with a hands-on attitude.
* Bonus: Interest in fashion and customer behaviour.

  

**Additional Information**  

This is a full time permanent contract based at our Head Office in Liljeholmen Stockholm


If you feel this opportunity is exciting feel free to apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible, but no later than the 21/9. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through our career page.


In this role you will have the flexibility to work both remotely and, from the office. While remote working is part of our offer, approx. 4 days per week office presence is required to foster strong collaborations and team work.


WHO WE ARE


At H&M Portfolio Brand we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people who share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, what we perceive as possible and how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world, therefore all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.


 WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE


We offer all our employees attractive benefits with broad development opportunities. All our employees receive a staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.


In addition to this, H&M-based colleagues also receive:

* 30 days holiday
* A collective agreement which includes pension and life insurance
* Wellness benefit 3000kr/year
* Benify Benefits Portal


JOIN US


Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.


We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.


We look forward to hearing from you

title: IT Operations Technician
description:
Do you want to be part of a supportive team where you can continue to develop and make a real difference? We are looking for an IT Operations Technician to join our Infrastructure & Operations team. This is a great opportunity for you who are in the beginning of your career and is up for a new challenge.


You will be part of our Infrastructure & Operations department, where we are responsible for the operation, maintenance, and development of the IT environment, network and cloud services. Our goal is to deliver a stable, secure, and modern IT environment that the entire organisation can rely on, today and in the future.

**Your role**


As an IT operations technician, you will work closely with users and experienced IT colleagues to provide the best possible support and operational assistance. You will be an important part of the team and contribute to the smooth and efficient functioning of the IT environment throughout the organisation.


Your work will be a mix of operational tasks, support, improvement work and will include:

* Incident management and troubleshooting.
* Performing routine maintenance and updates.
* Installing and configuring laptops, mobile phones, and other IT equipment.
* User management in our systems and services.
* Documenting cases and solutions in our IT service desk system.
* Participating in Infrastructure & Operations projects.
* Collaborating with the Helpdesk and other IT functions to solve problems quickly and efficiently.

**Qualifications**


We are looking for someone who has:

* A couple of years of experience in a similar role.
* Strong communication skills in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.
* Solid knowledge of:
* Windows operating systems
* Office 365 applications and SharePoint
* Active Directory and Azure/Entra ID

**Experience from**

* Mobile Device Management (Intune or similar).
* Management and troubleshooting of network printers.
* Teams-based meeting systems.

**Meritorious:**

* Experience with SCCM.
* Experience with MS Power Automate and MS Power Apps.
* Interest in IT security and automation.

**Who you are**


You are service-minded, curious, and genuinely interested in helping others. You are driven and take initiative, while also being responsible and able to work independently. You are reliable and keep your promises, and you enjoy working proactively to prevent problems before they occur. Your analytical skills and structured approach help you to quickly understand situations and find practical solutions. You bring positive energy to the team and see opportunities even in challenging situations. As a person, you are humble and cooperative, building trustful relationships both internally and externally.

**What we offer**


We offer good development opportunities in a stimulating work environment where you will have the opportunity to learn from experienced colleagues and gradually build up your competence in IT operations. With us, you will have a varied working day that combines both daily routines and exciting projects that develop both you and our business. We value a good work-life balance and offer flexible working. As an employee, you will be part of a stable company with good benefits and a collective bargaining agreement through Forena.


The position is full-time, based in Gothenburg, Sweden, starting with a 6-month probationary employment.

title: Product Owner DevOps & AI
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **10+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

 **Rollbeskrivning**:


Vi söker en Product Owner DevOps & AI. örändringsdrivande, pedagogisk och innovativ ledare


I rollen kommer du att utveckla ett DevSecOps-team och leda transformationen mot moderna, automatiserade och säkra IT-processer. Du ansvarar för att implementera och vidareutveckla agila arbetssätt, samtidigt som du coachar och utbildar både team och ledare. En viktig del av uppdraget är att utvärdera och införa nya teknologier och metoder som stärker leveranskapacitet, kvalitet och innovation – med särskilt fokus på AI och automatisering.


Du driver kunskapsdelning och skapar engagemang kring DevSecOps och AI i hela organisationen, och arbetar nära ledningsgrupper, avdelningar och team för att säkerställa att förändringsinitiativ genomförs smidigt och effektivt. Genom att stödja och coacha både organisationen och individerna i förändringsprocessen bidrar du till att främja en kultur av samarbete, delaktighet och kontinuerlig utveckling.


**Kvalifikationer:**

* Du har minst 10 års erfarenhet inom DevOps, varav flera år i ledande roller.
* Du har dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda DevSecOps-transformationer enligt SAFe-ramverket.
* Du har djup teknisk kompetens inom .NET, C#, Java, Azure DevOps, OpenShift, Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, automatisering och säkerhetsverktyg.
* Du har förmåga att utvärdera och implementera AI-lösningar för verksamhetsnytta, samt att driva innovation och kontinuerlig förbättring.
* Du har starka pedagogiska och kommunikativa färdigheter – du kan förklara komplexa tekniska koncept på ett sätt som engagerar och skapar förståelse.
* Du har erfarenhet av att utveckla och genomföra förändringsstrategier, coacha team och ledare samt skapa kulturförflyttning.
* Du har akademisk examen inom systemutveckling/datateknik och certifiering inom SAFe, Azure DevOps eller liknande.
* Erfarenhet från fintech, bank eller annan reglerad verksamhet är meriterande.


Personliga egenskaper:


* Pedagogisk och inspirerande – du skapar förståelse och engagemang för nya arbetssätt och teknologier.
* Innovativ och nytänkande – du driver kontinuerlig förbättring och vågar testa nya idéer.
* Kommunikativ och inkluderande – du bygger nätverk och skapar delaktighet på alla nivåer.
* Modig och lösningsorienterad – du tar initiativ och leder förändring med tilltro till organisationens förmåga.
* Analytisk och affärsdriven – du fokuserar på att skapa värde och mäta effekter av förändringsinitiativ.

**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Software Engineer / DevOps Engineer. Ready to power games that thrill the world?
description:
*Code is the backbone of great games. Build what others play*

We are looking for a curious and experienced engineer to join our backend team in Gothenburg. This role is flexible depending on your profile:

* **Backend Engineer** with a strong DevOps focus
* **DevOps Engineer** focused full-time on infrastructure, automation, and reliability


In both cases, you will help shape the systems that power our games, ensure stability at scale, and collaborate across teams to drive technical excellence. You will be part of a team that values shared decisions, open collaboration, and continuous learning.

#### **Who we are**


Solidicon is a leading software development company in the iGaming industry. We build innovative games and systems that captivate players and push technical boundaries. From crash games to classic casino titles, our products combine creativity, data, and tech into thrilling experiences for users across the globe.


We are a tight-knit team of 29 based in Gothenburg, working together with curiosity, ambition, and a shared love for building great stuff. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere and that the best results happen when decisions are made together, with open minds and low egos.


Our culture is built on respect and collaboration. We support one another, share what we know, and celebrate each other’s wins. A positive atmosphere is something we actively maintain because we know it drives creativity, well-being, and great work.


Our vision: **Setting hearts racing around the world, one thrilling game at a time.**

#### **About the role**


As part of our backend platform team, you will either:

* **Backend with DevOps focus**: Design and maintain backend services that support game logic, player data, and B2B integrations. At the same time, you will help drive improvements in cloud infrastructure, monitoring, and deployment pipelines.
* **Fully DevOps**: Take ownership of infrastructure, CI/CD, observability, and scaling systems across global cloud environments. You will work to ensure high uptime and performance across all production systems.


We value both paths and will tailor responsibilities depending on your strengths.


You will work mainly from our office on Avenyn in Gothenburg, with flexible remote work options.

#### **What you will do**

* Design, develop, and maintain backend services and/or cloud infrastructure
* Ensure uptime, scalability, and performance across Azure, Kubernetes, and GCP
* Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines, observability, and monitoring
* Troubleshoot issues in live environments and implement long-term fixes
* Contribute to architecture decisions and technical planning
* Collaborate with other engineers, game teams, and stakeholders to align technical solutions with business needs
* Share knowledge and best practices to strengthen the overall team

#### **What you bring**


We are looking for someone with either mid-level or senior-leve**l** experience. You might not know everything yet, but you are confident in your skills, eager to grow, and ready to take ownership of your work.

* Professional experience in software engineering and/or cloud infrastructure
* Programming skills in something like C#, Node.js or similar
* Experience with Azure, Kubernetes, Google Cloud or similar platforms
* Familiarity with databases like MongoDB and MySQL
* Comfortable with tools such as Git, Visual Studio, JetBrains, Postman and modern CI/CD systems
* A structured mindset, clear communication style, and willingness to collaborate
* Fluency in English (Swedish is a plus but not required)
* Based in or near Gothenburg, or open to relocating

#### **What we offer**


At Solidicon, you will join a respectful and collaborative team that believes the best outcomes happen when everyone feels empowered to contribute. We take pride in making decisions together, listening to each other’s perspectives, and creating an environment where ideas can be challenged and explored without fear.


You will also enjoy:

* Competitive salary and bonus program
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Private health insurance and a yearly health checkup
* Paid parental leave
* 10,000 SEK annual education allowance
* One personal development week per year
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance
* In-office massage every other week
* Weekly company workout sessions
* Option to lease a bike through Solidicon at a discounted rate
* Daily breakfast, free drinks, and snacks
* Regular afterworks, team lunches, and 1 to 2 company trips per year
* A culture of innovation, optimism, and continuous learning

#### **We invest in your growth**


At Solidicon, personal development is not just encouraged – it is structured into your year. All team members have access to:

**One paid personal development week per year** – a whole week dedicated to exploring new tools, technologies, and ideas. For example, our engineers have used it to:

* Experiment with scalable game server architecture in Kubernetes
* Deepen their understanding of game math and performance optimization
* Explore rendering techniques to improve real-time visuals

**An annual 10,000 SEK education allowance** – to fuel your curiosity. Previous uses include:

* Online courses on software performance and clean code
* Licenses for personal experimentation in new game engines
* Technical books and tools that sharpen backend skills


We value learning and trust that investing in people’s curiosity leads to stronger, more innovative systems.

#### **How to apply**


If you are ready to build systems that power the games of tomorrow, we would love to hear from you. Please send us your CV and a few lines about why this role excites you.


We review applications and conduct interviews on a rolling basis, so do not wait to reach out.

title: Programmerare / Automationstekniker till Elajo Bredaryd
description:
*Tycker du om tekniska lösningar, att jobba med system samt installation?*

*Har du dessutom en ambition att utvecklas inom, och med, vår organisation där du värdesätter en arbetsplats med stark laganda?*

*Då kan det vara dig vi söker!*

### **Arbetsuppgifter**


I rollen som programmerare/driftsättare kommer du att arbeta mot våra kunder i Bredaryd med omnejd. Arbetet kommer bestå av:

* programmering/driftsättning av tekniska anläggningar inom industri och fastighet
* kontroll, underhåll, felsökning och reparation av el- och styrutrustning
* Installation, montering av elektrisk utrustning


Du kommer få möjlighet att arbeta med modern teknik och nya innovativa lösningar samtidigt som du kommer utveckla dina kunskaper inom programmering och driftsättning.


Hos oss kan du förvänta dig engagerade ledare, kompetenta kollegor och en god sammanhållning i teamet, där vi ser fram emot att få välkomna en ny kollega!

### **Bakgrund och Kompetenser**

* Minst fullgjord el-utbildning inom automation på gymnasienivå
* Flerårig erfarenhet av programmering är ett krav
* Då vi mestadels jobbar med Siemens styrsystem är detta meriterande men även andra styrsystem såsom Mitsubishi, ABB, Rockwell, Beckhoff och Wago förekommer.
* Goda kunskaper i ritningsläsning samt felsökning på maskiner och anläggningar, minst fyra års erfarenhet
* Dator- och systemvana
* B-körkort är ett krav


Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och att du vill vara med och utveckla framtidens Elajo. Vi värdesätter särskilt att du har ett brinnande intresse för automation och service.


Som person har du god social kompetens med en positiv attityd och är lyhörd för kundens behov. Du har en god prioriteringsförmåga och är kvalitetsmedveten i ditt arbete. Du tar ansvar för ditt eget arbete och trivs med att arbeta i team.


Denna position kan komma att innebära att du genomgår en säkerhetsprövning baserat på gällande föreskrifter kring/av säkerhetsskydd.

### **Vad Elajo erbjuder**

* Ett öppet arbetsklimat med stark laganda där vi stöttar varandra och har kul tillsammans
* Möjlighet att kunna jobba lokalt eller på flera orter
* Trygghet och stabilitet
* Alla medarbetare får tillgång till samtalsstöd kring hälsa, kris, sorg, stress men även ekonomi och juridik
* Kollektivavtal, personalrabatter och friskvårdsbidrag tar du med enkelhet del av genom vår förmånsportal Elajo4U
* Bred kunskap inom bolaget med fokus på teknikutveckling
* En gemenskap och ett starkt affärsmannaskap

### **Våra värderingar**


Vår värdegrund bygger på **Engagemang**, **Utveckling**, **Öppenhet** och **Förtroende**. Vi strävar efter jämställdhet och mångfald, där alla ges lika möjligheter och olikheter uppskattas och respekteras. Hos Elajo får du möjlighet att kombinera karriär med balans i livet.

### **Om Elajo**


Elajo är en av Sveriges ledande aktörer inom el, säkerhet, mekanik och energi. Med över 800 medarbetare och verksamhet på 39 orter erbjuder vi bred kompetens och utvecklingsmöjligheter. Med lång erfarenhet, bred kompetens och stark lokal närvaro inom vårt teknikområde el & energi levererar vi tjänster inom elinstallation, service och projektering.

### **Ansökan**


Vi tar gärna emot din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Intervjuer sker löpande. Sista ansökningsdag 2025-10-12.


För ytterligare information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta:

* Andreas Eriksson, Distriktschef, på telefonnummer: 0370-374153

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

*Inför denna rekrytering har Elajo tagit ställning till rekryteringskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanbeder oss därför vänligt men bestämt kontakt med mediesäljare, rekryteringsbolag och liknande.*

title: Senior Functional Specialist within Microsoft Dynamics 365 FnO
description:
**We are now looking for a Senior Functional Specialist within Microsoft Dynamics 365 FnO for a global company in Malmö. Start ASAP, 3 months contract to start with, possibility of extension after that.**

**Job Description:**


Do you want to help shape the digital future of our customer engagement Products?


We are seeking a motivated and skilled **Senior Functional Specialist** to enhance our After Sales Support product offering. This role is crucial in ensuring that our ERP integrates with various dependent systems, including POS, E-commerce, ERP, and Sign-Up Portal. By doing so, you will play an integral part in elevating customer engagement and driving business success for our retailers globally.


Our vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people, and this mission influences everything we do worldwide. In this role, you will be part of **Retail Operation Solution and Support** **(ROSS)**, the unit responsible for developing, delivering, and managing the digital offering for our retailers globally.

**About You…**


You are a proactive, skilled and Senior Functional Specialist in FnO, with a passion for delivering reliable and high-performance solution. You bring hands-on experience within FnO modules having deep experience in Dynamics 365 F&O Retail & Commerce module.

**As an Senior Functional Specialist in FnO, You Will…**

* **Design and configure:** Dynamics 365 Supply Chain modules essentially Sales & Marketing, Customer Returns, Retail and commerce process flow knowledge. Additional knowledge and experience in Product information, Inventory, logistics, warehouse, procurement is advantage
* **FnO modules:** Deep experience in Dynamics 365 F&O Retail & Commerce module consultant (setting up channels, stores, payments, pricing etc.)
* **Configure D365:** Order Management, Return order management is essential and good to have knowledge in Case management, Item Management, Inventory, Master Planning, Warehousing, Procurement, Vendor Management.
* **Documentation:** Writing design documents for any customizations and reports for D365. Create and maintain clear and comprehensive technical documentation such as API and integration specifications, development guidelines, system architecture diagrams, error handling, security compliance
* **Quality Assurance:** Build and embed quality assurance in everything we do to ensure we deliver a good quality product that meets customers’ requirements and expectations.
* **Collaboration:** Team spirit mindset as an effective collaboration to support to Product team colleagues to contribute to a successful delivery. Work closely CROSS Teams, as Product Owners, Technical Leads, Developers, and System Architects to align integration efforts with the overall product strategy and customer engagement goals, contributing to a positive and fun team culture.

**Qualifications:**

**Education:** A bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, business administration.

**Experience:**

* Proven experience in Dynamics 365 F&O Retail & Commerce module
* Strong knowledge of payment systems, pricing models, and retail channel configurations.
* Experience in end-to-end Dynamics 365 F&O module implementation
* Experience working in large enterprises

**Skills:**

* Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to drive insights


This role requires fluency in English.


This is a full-time consultant position through Incluso in Malmö. Start is ASAP, 3 months limited contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that. This role is 100% onsite in Malmö.


Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.


For more information about this role, please contact Marianne Nilsson, recruiter at Incluso.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Company Description**  

We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!  

  

We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.  

  

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.


We are looking for you who want to grow with us!  

  

With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

 **Job Description**  

We are looking for several Data Engineers to join our team and contribute to the development, maintenance, and optimization of modern data platforms and cloud-based API solutions. The role involves both operational support and ongoing development of data processes, pipelines, and integrations to ensure reliable and accessible data for business-critical applications and analytics.

**As a Data Engineer, you will:**

* Design, build, and maintain systems for collecting, storing, and processing large-scale data.
* Develop and test architectures for data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL/ELT).
* Work with cloud-based solutions, primarily Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Build and maintain API solutions in the cloud, including critical sales and transactional flows.
* Take ownership of both development initiatives and operational maintenance tasks.
* Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize data flows to ensure system reliability.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Pipeline Management: Maintain and enhance processes for ingesting, transforming, and delivering data.
* API Development: Develop and maintain cloud-based APIs used by multiple applications.
* Incident Management: Troubleshoot and resolve issues such as API performance degradation, failed pipelines, or missing data.
* Availability & SLA: Participate in extended SLA coverage (including early mornings, evenings, and weekends) with a commitment to respond to incidents within 60 minutes.

  

**Qualifications** **Requirements**

* Proven experience as a Data Engineer working with large-scale data systems.
* Strong hands-on expertise with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Experience developing and maintaining APIs.
* Solid background in working with databases and large datasets.
* Familiarity with troubleshooting and incident management in production environments.

 **Desired Skills & Attributes**

* Analytical and solution-oriented mindset.
* Structured and detail-oriented with a strong focus on quality.
* Strong communication and teamwork skills.
* Flexibility and willingness to take responsibility outside normal office hours when required.

  

**Additional Information** **Start**: Asap  

**Location**: Stockholm

**Note: Candidates must currently reside in Stockholm, Sweden, or be eligible to work locally.**  

  

We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

title: Systemspecialist till Bonnier News
description:
**Vill du arbeta i hjärtat av en snabbt växande mediekoncern och göra skillnad för både kunder och kollegor? Som Systemspecialist på Bonnier News blir du en nyckelperson i att utveckla och optimera våra system för kundservice. Här får du kombinera teknisk förståelse med problemlösning och utbildning och vara med och skapa smarta, användarvänliga lösningar som gör vardagen enklare för medarbetare och läsare.**

**Om oss:**  

Bonnier News är Skandinaviens största aktör inom nyhetsmedia med varumärken som Dagens Nyheter, Expressen, Sundsvalls Tidning, Dagens industri, m fl. Inom Bonnier News värnar vi om det fria ordet och gör skillnad genom journalistik som når och berör många, totalt når vår journalistik över 6 miljoner läsare varje dag!


Bonnier News strävar efter att vara marknadens mest attraktiva affärspartner. Vi jobbar i en engagerad miljö med att skapa och sälja nytänkande koncept och innovativa annonslösningar.  



  

**Om rollen:**  

Inom prenumerationsplattformen används Salesforce Service Cloud samt Advantage som kundservice gränssnitt mot plattformen samt som affärens CRM-verktyg. Våra kundservicemedarbetare hanterar dagligen mängder av ärenden såsom start, ändring och cancellering av prenumerationer i Salesforce samt Advantage. Mycket av den bakomvarande logiken utvecklas i vårt eget integrationslager, vilket också utgör navet i integrationen mellan Salesforce, Advantage och andra system. Bonnier News växer snabbt, genom nya förvärv och en framgångsrik prenumerationsaffär, det är viktigt att användarna får rätt verktyg för att hantera ny samt befintlig funktionalitet och effektivt kunna hantera det ökande antalet kunder.


***Dina främsta arbetsuppgifterna är***

* I rollen som Systemspecialist i Kundservice Excellens säkerställer du att Kundservice prenumerations- och ärendehanteringssystem fungerar optimalt. Det innefattar den dagliga hantering av teknik för att optimera användarvänligheten för medarbetare och chefer samt eskaleringar och uppföljningar.
* I nuvarande systemansvar ingår både telefonisystem kombinerat med AI funktioner som automatiserar kundkontakt och processer.
* Train the trainer - ge relevant utbildning till personer inom Kundservice.
* Driva funktionsutveckling i våra system som ökar effektivitet, automation eller nya funktioner tillsammans med leverantör och/eller interna avdelningar. Utöver detta kan det förekomma supportärenden för Salesforce, Puzzel (telefonisystem) etc

**Vem är du?**  

För att trivas hos oss är du en lagspelare som gärna delar kunskap och samarbetar. Du är kommunikativ, lösningsorienterad och trivs i en agil miljö. Med din analytiska förmåga ser du samband mellan system och verksamhet och kan prioritera på ett effektivt sätt.


Vi tror att du är nyfiken på teknik och drivs av att utveckla och förenkla processer. Du har en stark servicekänsla och sätter alltid användarnas behov i fokus. Samtidigt bygger du relationer med lätthet och är trygg i att be om hjälp och involvera andra när det behövs. Ditt arbetssätt är framåtlutat och affärsmässigt, och du har förmågan att prioritera utifrån vad som skapar mest värde.


***Kvalifikationer:***

* Högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande från relevant utbildning tex Datateknik eller motsvarande.
* God teknisk förståelse och intresse
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och ta egna initiativ
* Bra kommunikationsförmåga, både muntligt och skriftligt
* Meriterande med erfarenhet av projektledning eller föreningsengagemang
* God datorvana och trygg i Google Suite, gillar att lära nya system
* Djup förståelse för våra system och hur de samverkar för verksamhet, kundservice och kunder

**Meriterande**

* CRM och ärendehanteringssystem SalesForce eller motsvarande
* Telefonisystem, Puzzel eller motsvarande
* Grundläggande databashantering / SQL för analys av trafik
* Kundanalyssystem, InidcateMe eller motsvarande
* Grundläggande erfarenhet i hur AI används i kommersiell miljö

**Övrig information:**  

Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning som börjar med en 6 månaders provanställning.


Du kommer att tillhöra teamet Kundservice Excellens. Du rapporterar till Mikael Larsson och tillsammans sitter vi i ”Tidningshuset” på Gjörwellsgatan 30, Kungsholmen i Stockholm.  

  



Hos Bonnier News får du ta del av ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag på 5000 kr, rabatter, fri prenumeration på våra nyheter, extra ersättning vid föräldraledighet samt en konkurrenskraftig pensionslösning inom ITP enligt vårt kollektivavtal. Vi tror att det bästa upplägget är en mix av att ses på kontoret och ta tillvara de positiva effekterna det ger, samtidigt som du har möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån när det behövs för att få ihop livspusslet och bibehålla fokus. Framför allt erbjuder vi en trygg arbetsplats med väl utformade kollektivavtal, en inspirerande arbetsmiljö och engagerade kollegor.  

  



För att få reda på mer om vår rekryteringsprocess, klicka här !
