Genom modern teknik som Java och Python och med vår erfarenhet inom mjukvaruutveckling och DevOps skapar vi innovativa, skalbara lösningar som hjälper våra kunder att nå sina mål."
   

  

**Bakgrund:** 
 Android apputvecklare till Appteamet/fabriken. Vi har flera initiativ där vi har iOS versionen redan för diagnosspecifika patientappar, men behöver komma ikapp med utvecklingen för Android.
   

  

**Uppdragsbeskrivning:**
 Utveckla diverse diagnosspecifika appar för Android.
   

  

**Att leverera:**
* Kompetensprofil konsult:
* Produktutvecklings-mindset
* Har en analytisk approach till komplexa problem
* Trivs i en föränderlig miljö
* Trivs i att jobba i små sammansvetsade team
* Nyfiken, positiv och ansvarstagande
* Enkelhet före komplexitet
* Mycket god samarbetsförmåga och förmåga att arbeta effektivt både självständigt och i grupp
* Du har förmåga att uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska.
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt


**Nödvändig kompetens:**
* Högskoleutbildning IT eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Minst åtta års erfarenhet av apputveckling, Android.
* Android-utveckling, Kotlin


**Plats:** 
 Göteborg
   

  

**Önskvärd kompetens:**
* Erfarenhet och kunskap av arbete med tillgänglighet
* Erfarenhet av dataskydd, Data Protection by Default by Design
* God kännedom inom system- och applikationssäkerhet


**"Bli en del av vårt framgångsrika team"**
 "På VIPAS AB värdesätter vi drivna och engagerade medarbetare. Vi erbjuder attraktiva villkor och en arbetsmiljö som främjar kompetensutveckling och karriärtillväxt. Hos oss får du arbeta med spännande projekt inom flera branscher och bidra till banbrytande IT-lösningar tillsammans med ett erfarent och innovativt team."
   

  

**"Vi vill höra från dig"**
 "Tveka inte – skicka din ansökan till kumud@vipas.se och upptäck möjligheterna hos VIPAS AB."
   

  

**Behörighet för ansökan :-** 
 "För att kunna ansöka krävs svenskt medborgarskap eller ett giltigt arbetstillstånd för Sverige."
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 "Intresserade kandidater uppmanas att skicka in CV och personligt brev. Observera att rekryteringen sker löpande, vilket innebär att tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum."

title: Automotive - Business Development Manager
description:
**Role: Automotive** 
 -
 **Business Development Manager** 




**Experience (Years): 8+ Years** 




  





**Tata consultancy Services** 
 is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





**About the job:** 




  





 Your mission will be to develop customers especially in the Automotive Engineering and Digital IT Portfolio in order to acquire new customers and retain existing ones. Working closely with multiple sales teams, Center of Excellence(s) and Delivery team(s), he/she will be responsible for :
 


* Contribution to the elaboration and implementation of the sales strategy and sales action plans with the Clients
* The domains could be Automotive, auto Tier 1s, Manufacturingetc..
* The technical areas for Growth could be digital services, automotive engineering, Core Design and Software Engineering , PLM , ALM , MES , Manufacturing operations, Ind4,o Connected products and Services Portfolio
* Loyalty and growth of the existing perimeter
* Development of business with prospects and open new opportunities
* Participation in the response to calls for tenders, within the framework of T&M or fixed-price projects
* Analyze the technical and business needs of customers, in order to adapt potential offers
* Build its external and internal network by relying on key stakeholders.
* Achieving both revenue and Sales target and develop a strong pipeline for future
* Key Coordination with Onsite & offshore team for solutioning , delivery and Innovation



 You will be entrusted with a regional portfolio with several target & existing accounts (multi-sectoral and key account-oriented approach) that you will have to develop.
 



 You will start your activity with an existing pipeline and the objective will be to develop existing accounts and eventually bring new logos in hunting mode.
 







**YOUR PROFILE:** 



* 8+ years of experience including in the sales of services or solutions
* Developed commercial understanding and ability to identify potential deals, take appointments, map client accounts
* Appreciated experience in the sale of IT & Digital Engineering solutions/ services
* Ability to understand and challenge clients' technical topics
* Technological understanding of Digital Engineering solutions: Shopfloor IT, PLM, MES, etc.
* Domain understanding across multiple industries
* Good understanding of Onsite / Offshore model in the Engineering and IOT Domain
* Good command on English and/or Swedish
* Good understanding of the Swedish Market and connects.



  





**Does that sound interesting?** 




  





 You are welcome to submit your application consisting of your CV, personal letter, relevant degrees or certifications details, professional references, etc. We work with ongoing recruitment so send in your application as soon as possible.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application via LinkedIn or mail to
 **ajay.androw@tcs.com** 




  





**Privacy Note: https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice**

title: Head of Partner Sales & Operations
description:
*Are you commercially driven, globally minded, and thrive in dynamic environments? At GANT, we're building the future of fashion retail across international partner markets—and we’re looking for someone to be our Head of Partner sales and operations. This is your opportunity to work cross-functionally and internationally, leading impactful sales and business development with some of our most important markets and partners.*
 As Head of Partner Sales & Operations, you will lead commercial development in selected smaller markets and support strategic growth in larger territories. You’ll work closely with distribution partners to drive sell-in and sell-out performance, develop and execute business and investment plans, and ensure smooth day-to-day operations across all channels. You will be a key bridge between our partners and Global HQ—ensuring transparency, alignment, and impact.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Drive sales growth (sell-out) and increase partner orders (sell-in) across key markets
* Set and deliver commercial targets and brand plans, both annual and long-term
* Build and manage strong, trust-based relationships with distribution partners
* Lead planning, forecasting, business reviews, and market development actions
* Ensure operational support, including stock management, payment follow-up, and execution
* Act as the main liaison between partners and internal teams
* Oversee legal and administrative aspects of distribution agreements (in collaboration with Legal)
* 3–5 years’ experience in partner sales, business development, or similar roles
* Strong commercial acumen with understanding of retail and wholesale business models
* Skilled in stakeholder management and building long-term relationships
* Proven ability to analyze markets and identify growth opportunities
* Experience across multiple sales channels: retail, wholesale, outlet, e-com
* High level of self-leadership, structure, and adaptability in a dynamic environment
* Be able and willing to travel frequently


 Apply with your CV in English by 2025/10/31. Our team reviews applications on a rolling basis, so seize the opportunity to join us by submitting your application today! Please note that this position may be filled before the set end date.
   

  

 GANT stands as an emblem of American Sportswear, symbolizing timeless style and innovation across 70+ global markets. As a company, we blend heritage with contemporary flair, crafting apparel for the bold, the curious, and the imaginative. Our brand represents more than fashion; it's a tradition of excellence and authenticity. As an employer, we foster a culture of continuous learning and creativity, inviting high performers to join our diverse team of innovators. At GANT, we're not just shaping the future of fashion; we're redefining what it means to dress with purpose and passion.

title: Informationssäkerhetsspecialist
description:
Vill du vara med och bygga upp och driva informationssäkerhetsarbetet i en organisation med högt i tak, familjär kultur och en arbetsmiljö som präglas av både engagemang och glädje? Vi söker nu en senior Informationssäkerhetsspecialist som vill ta ett helhetsansvar för styrning, struktur och efterlevnad inom informationssäkerhet.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 Som Informationssäkerhetsspecialist får du en nyckelroll i att utveckla och strukturera organisationens informationssäkerhetsarbete. Du arbetar brett mot hela verksamheten och blir en del av ett mindre team som ansvarar för enhetsstöd, compliance och inköp. Rollen innebär stort eget ansvar där du självständigt driver arbetet framåt, men samtidigt arbetar nära kollegor inom juridik, IT, dataskydd och övriga stödfunktioner.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter:**
* Utveckla och driva informationssäkerhetsområdet inom organisationen.
* Bygga och förvalta ledningssystem för informationssäkerhet (ISMS).
* Arbeta med riskhantering, compliance och regelverk (t.ex. DORA, ISO-standarder).
* Ta fram policies, riktlinjer och rutiner samt följa upp efterlevnad.
* Genomföra analyser, revisioner och rapportering till ledning.
* Stödja organisationen vid incidenter och utbilda i informationssäkerhet.
* Samverka med interna och externa parter för att säkerställa kravuppfyllelse.


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som är trygg och erfaren i rollen och kan ta ansvar för att forma och leda arbetet. Du är social, kommunikativ och fungerar som en intern konsult – en person som både kan driva frågor på egen hand och samtidigt bidra till teamets utveckling.
   

  

**Vi ser att du har:**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom informationssäkerhet.
* God kunskap om ISO-standarder och regelverk såsom ISO/IEC 27001, 27002, DORA eller liknande.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att skriva policies och riktlinjer.
* Bakgrund från bank/försäkring eller offentlig verksamhet är meriterande.
* Förmåga att arbeta strategiskt med styrning, struktur och efterlevnad (ej tekniknära).


**Personliga egenskaper:**
* Självständig, driven och initiativtagande.
* Senior i sättet – trygg, lösningsorienterad och pedagogisk.
* Social och samarbetsinriktad, van vid att arbeta tvärfunktionellt.
* Strukturerad och analytisk, med förmåga att skapa tydlighet och ordning.


 Här får du möjlighet att arbeta i en verksamhet som aktivt satsar på att bygga upp sin egen kompetens och organisation. Du blir en del av ett mindre, sammansvetsat team och får en central roll i att etablera och utveckla informationssäkerhetsområdet. Kulturen är öppen, social och dynamisk.
   

  

**Om CONSULTING it:**
 När du börjar hos oss som konsult på CONSULTING it blir du en del av vår gemenskap. Du får dessutom kollegor runt om i Sverige! Du har en dedikerad konsultchef som stöttar dig och din utveckling. Vi hjälper dig hitta nya vägar genom att prova på nya roller och nya branscher, för oss är det viktigt att du trivs på din arbetsplats. Vi ser till att du hamnar på ett bra bolag under ditt uppdrag och att uppdragen ligger i linje med hur du vill utvecklas framöver. Oavsett vad det blir, står vi bakom dig hela vägen – i ditt nästa, nästa och nästa steg. Gå med i vårt team och ta del av en spännande och utvecklande arbetsmiljö!

title: Analytical Consultant, Large Customer Sales
job_function: Sales, General Business, and Customer Service
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience in digital media, sales, marketing, or product roles.
* Experience working with digital organizations.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Experience developing customer relationships to support product adoption.
* Experience identifying key internal stakeholders to build networks and contribute to cross-functional collaboration.
* Ability to develop relationships with customers acting as a product Subject Matter Expert (SME) for customers and agencies.
* Ability to translate client business needs into product adoption opportunities.


**About The Job**
 Being an Analyst at Google is about much more than simply crunching numbers – it’s about finding compelling insights within data and using your exceptional business and communication skills to translate those insights into action. As one of the masterminds behind our strategic planning, forecasting and analysis, you’ll spend your time digging into big, complex data sets. The data will not remain inert in your hands, however, since you’ll use your critical thinking, problem solving and communication skills to influence and drive thoughtful and well-informed decision making with our most senior business leaders within the organization, and potentially some of our biggest clients.
   

  

 As an Analytical Consultant in Large Customer Sales (LCS), you will deliver data-driven decision-making for our customers. You will achieve this by assessing customer needs, informed by a strong understanding of the macro and industry environment and its impact on our clients and then leading comprehensive analysis, and activating insights through compelling pitches. You will operate as customer-centric sales analysts, dedicating significant time to direct engagement with our customer stakeholders.
   

  

 Google's Large Customer Sales (LCS) teams are strategic partners and industry thought leaders to the world's leading brands and agencies. We continuously challenge how customers think about their business and how
   

  

 Google can support growth. We focus on helping these players navigate profound industry shifts and drive outsized business performance by competitively selling Google's full suite of advertising solutions across Search, YouTube, Measurement, and more. As a member of our LCS team, you'll have the unique opportunity to sell at the forefront of technology, collaborating with executives, influencing market-shaping strategies, and delivering tangible results that significantly impact major global businesses and drive the growth of Google.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Become a trusted advisor by understanding customer business and marketing goals, then leveraging insights to help them achieve those objectives faster.
* Develop custom insights analysis for Google's customers. This helps them identify opportunities, make better decisions, and achieve business goals (e.g., by showing how their online presence aligns with consumer demand, optimizing their next year's budget, or identifying product categories).
* Scale best practices in insights from our customers to the entire portfolio through effective training, clear processes, compelling narratives, and adaptable templates.
* Co-lead at least one area of learning and innovation, such as Artificial Intelligence (AI) applications for analysts or advanced branding insights.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Workplace Tekniker
description:
*Vi söker nu en Workplace-tekniker till vårt team Digital Workplace – en nyckelroll där du ansvarar över vårt interna klientansvar.*
 Digital Workplace är en del av vår interna IT-organisation och ansvarar för teknisk support och utveckling av IT-miljön för över 2000 medarbetare i Sverige och Danmark. I teamet finns sju tekniker med hög kompetens och stort engagemang, och vi lär av varandra i takt med att tekniken utvecklas.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Workplace-tekniker ansvarar du för livscykelhantering av våra klientplattformar, både Windows och macOS. Du arbetar med verktyg som MECM, Intune och Jamf för applikationsdistribution, patchhantering och policyimplementering. Arbetet innebär även att bygga och testa klientlösningar i vår miljö, och vid behov besöka våra butiker för verifiering på plats.
   

  

 Du kommer att hantera imagehantering, Active Directory och Group Policy, felsöka och strukturera samt arbeta med säkerhetskonfigurationer som brandväggsinställningar och certifikat. Rollen omfattar även 2nd- och 3rd line-support samt integration av macOS-klienter via MDM-verktyg.
   

  

**Du kan se fram emot att**
* vara en del av att leverera kritisk infrastruktur och bidra direkt till samhällsnyttan
* vara en del av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser enligt Great Place To Work samt att vi är stolt samarbetspartner till Women in Tech och Tjejer Kodar


 ,
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har flerårig erfarenhet från en liknande roll i en större IT-miljö. Du har djup kompetens inom MECM, Intune, Azure AD och Active Directory. Du är van vid klientdistribuering, imagehantering, GPO, PowerShell och att arbeta i hybridmiljöer. Erfarenhet av macOS-hantering, gärna med Jamf, är viktigt. Det är meriterande om du även har lett eller samordnat IT-projekt kopplade till exempelvis uppgraderingar eller förändringar.
   

  

 Du är lösningsorienterad, nyfiken och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap. Du har B-körkort och behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Vi tar emot ansökningar via denna annons och kommer hålla intervjuer löpande. Personligt brev behövs inte, men vi vill gärna att du bifogar CV och svarar på de frågor vi ställt nedan i samband med att du söker. Vi använder tester för att säkra objektiva bedömningar i samband med urval. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Bakgrundskontroll görs på slutkandidat.

title: Senior Manager, Project Management
description:
**Job Description**
**Primary Duties & Responsibilities**
**Strategic Leadership**
* Actively participate as a member of the Product Development Management Team.
* Contribute to setting annual goals, department budgets, and long-term (5-year) development roadmaps.
* Participate in shaping organizational structure and making recruitment decisions for the broader department.


**Program & Project Execution**
* Lead the Project Management Team, ensuring successful delivery of product development projects in line with scope, budget, and timeline.
* Support your project managers in leading cross-functional teams from idea to production handover.
* Ensure each project meets its stage gate requirements and milestones.
* Coordinate with Product Line Management and Operations to ensure sample and pre-production volumes meet internal and customer needs.
* Provide clear, structured reporting on project portfolio status to senior management.
* Escalate risks and drive mitigation and recovery plans where needed.


**Process & Continuous Improvement**
* Own and evolve the project management methodology and best practices used within Product Development.
* Continuously refine gate models, templates, and steering mechanisms to increase project predictability and effectiveness.
* Ensure consistent and harmonized execution of projects across the organization.
* Drive a learning culture through post-mortem reviews and structured feedback loops.


**Required Qualifications**
* Advanced degree (M.Sc. or Ph.D.) in engineering, physics, or a related technical field.
* Demonstrated experience in managing teams and leading complex product development projects.
* Formal training and certification in project management strongly preferred.
* A solid foundation in high-tech engineering – experience in semiconductors or adjacent industries is a plus.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, comfortable interfacing with all organizational levels.
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written.
* Willingness to travel internationally to meet with cross-functional teams and customers.


**Key Competencies**
* Strong business acumen and customer focus.
* Results-oriented, with a drive for excellence in execution.
* Passion for leadership, with a collaborative and motivational approach.
* Structured and clear communicator who adapts messages to diverse audiences.
* Curious and improvement-minded, continuously seeking better ways to lead and deliver.


**Safety Requirements**
 All employees are required to attend scheduled training, follow the site EHS procedures and II-VI Corporate EHS standards. This includes the use of proper protective equipment (PPE) as required by the job responsibilities.
   

  

 Managers will ensure that all safety and environmental procedures are followed consistently. They will ensure that risk assessments are performed, proper training, work instructions, required PPE is available, and will monitor compliance.
   

  

**Quality & Environmental Responsibilities**
 Depending on location, this position may be responsible for the execution and maintenance of the ISO 9000, 9001, 14001 and/or other applicable standards that may apply to the relevant roles and responsibilities within the Quality Management System and Environmental Management System.
   

  

**Cultural Commitment**
* Ensure adherence to company’s values (ICARE) in all aspects of your position at Coherent:
* Integrity – Create an Environment of Trust
* Collaboration – Innovate Through the Sharing of Ideas
* Accountability – Own the Process and the Outcome
* Respect – Recognize the Value in Everyone
* Enthusiasm – Find a Sense of Purpose in Work


**We offer**
* A dynamic, international environment with cutting-edge technologies.
* A culture that values trust, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
* An influential leadership role with strategic impact.
* Competitive compensation and above-average social benefits.
* A workplace where you can truly make a difference in tomorrow’s products.


**Recruitment & Selection Process**
 We review applications on an ongoing basis and may schedule interviews before the application deadline. Due to the high volume of applications, we are unfortunately unable to respond to each applicant personally. Our selection process includes digital and on-site interviews at our facility in Järfälla, as well as reference and background checks. Alcohol and drug testing are also part of the process. Please note that this is an on-site role based in Järfälla, Sweden. We are not able to offer relocation assistance or visa sponsorship for this position.
   

  

**About Us**
 Coherent is a global leader in lasers, engineered materials and networking components. We are a vertically integrated manufacturing company that develops innovative products for diversified applications in the industrial, optical communications, military, life sciences, semiconductor equipment, and consumer markets. Coherent provides a comprehensive career development platform within an environment that challenges employees to perform at their best, while rewarding excellence and hard-work through a competitive compensation program. It's an exciting opportunity to work for a company that offers stability, longevity and growth. Come Join Us!
   

  

**Note to recruiters and employment agencies:** 
 We will not pay for unsolicited resumes from recruiters and employment agencies unless we have a signed agreement and have required assistance, in writing, for a specific opening.

title: Senior Arkitekt
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Mycket stark erfarenhet av C# och tillhörande ramverk.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet som arkitekt och problemlösare i komplexa systemmiljöer.
* God förståelse för molnlösningar i Azure och gärna erfarenhet av molntransformationer.
* Erfarenhet av skalbara, transaktionsintensiva system.
* Erfarenhet av domändriven utveckling (DDD).
* Förmåga att arbeta med både backend och frontend (fullstack).
* Positivt om du även har erfarenhet av funktionella språk.
* En ödmjuk och prestigelös ledarstil, med förmåga att inspirera och stötta andra.
* Civilingenjörsexamen eller motsvarande bakgrund är meriterande.
* Flytande svenska är ett krav.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 15-09-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Senior Project Manager
description:
**Who** 
**are Benifex?** 
**💚💜**
**We are a fast-moving technology company, and one of the most successful providers of online reward and benefits solutions in the world. We believe that everyone deserves** 
**an exceptional experience at work, every day, and build workplace technology that makes this happen. Benifex’s mission is to build remarkable experiences that employees love. Today Benifex supports more than five million employees in over 3,000 organisations across more than 100 countries. To help us on our quest to be the best, we need brilliant people on board and that’s where you come in. 🚀**
 As a Senior Project Manager with us, you will lead complex B2B implementations and further development of our SaaS solution for both new and existing customers. You have overarching responsibility for establishing strong collaboration both internally and externally, aligning customer expectations with our delivery — ensuring that projects are delivered on time, within budget, and with high product adoption and customer satisfaction as key goals.
   

  

 In the projects you lead, you will work closely with integration, configuration, and content specialists, taking ownership from the first customer contact through to launch. A successful project identifies value-creating opportunities for the customer and builds engagement through strong stakeholder management. We work in an agile way, and you are responsible for proactive and strategic planning of your squad’s resources and customer deliverables to ensure efficient and profitable launches.
   

  

 Within our Delivery team, we manage all Nordic customers across both public and private sectors — a dynamic environment characterized by variety, high pace, and strong development potential.
   

  

**As a Project Manager, You Will Be Responsible For**
* Understanding and translating customer business needs into concrete solutions on our platform
* Acting as an advisor on our product portfolio, best practices within employee benefits and engagement throughout the entire project, with a focus on long-term value and strong product adoption
* Creating and implementing a communication plan together with the customer to ensure employee engagement at launch
* Driving continuous development of our processes with a focus on customer experience, scalability, and quality
* Creating and communicating a clear project plan with ongoing follow-up to ensure that customers deliver the right input at the right time for a smooth system setup


**Personal attributes**
 You are a
 **customer-oriented** 
 and
 **result-driven** 
 project leader who thrives on building trust with diverse stakeholders. With a sharp focus on outcomes, you know how to translate client needs into high-impact solutions — always aiming to meet deadlines and exceed expectations. It’s important with a meticulous and business-driven mindset focused on building the right solution for the customer's operations.
   

  

 Your
 **organized** 
 mindset keeps projects on track, while your
 **initiative-taking** 
 attitude means you're quick to identify risks, offer creative solutions, and go beyond the brief to create real value. Clear, adaptable
 **communication** 
 is your superpower — making complex ideas simple and engaging for everyone involved.
   

  

**We Also Believe That You Have**
* Solid experience in customer-facing project management and/or a coordinating role involving complex problem solving within tech, SaaS, IT, or similar fields
* Proven experience leading complex implementations, preferably in customer-centric environments, and familiarity with agile methods and project management methodologies
* A strong technical interest, an eye for detail, and a drive to contribute to customer satisfaction through a professional and service-oriented approach
* A communicative leadership style and fluency in both Swedish and English, written and spoken. Additional language skills are always welcome! 🙌


**Perks** 
**of working at Benifex**
* Collective agreement
* Generous wellness allowance
* 30 days vacation
* ITP1 Pension and Lifeplan - a pension tool that provides you with personalized advice to optimize your retirement planning
* Guaranteed work-life balance with a hybrid work model
* A variety of social events and activities in the offices
* You're responsible for your own development and we offer internal career opportunities


**Practical information**
**Start:** 
 As soon as we find our perfect match
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Extent:** 
 Full time
   

  

*Apply by submitting your CV and/or your LinkedIn profile using the application form below. Please note that due to summer holidays, there may be a delay in our response. Interviews will begin in mid to late August at the latest.*
*Please let us know if you need any reasonable adjustments for interviews by replying to the email you will receive after you apply.*

title: Security GRC Analyst
description:
**Juni who? 👋**
 At Juni, we’re busy building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.
   

  

**How & Why We Do It 🚀**
 We give our people the same thing we’re building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what’s more – make the most of it. We truly believe we’re making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.
   

  

**Your role at a glance 🤸‍♀️**
 Juni is seeking a Security GRC (Governance, Risk, and Compliance) Analyst to play a crucial role in aligning our information security posture with industry best practices, regulatory requirements, and internal policies. As a Level 2 analyst, you will demonstrate significant independence in your work, taking ownership of maintaining and improving our security governance framework. This role is key to managing risks, ensuring compliance, and fostering a strong security culture across the organisation. You will work closely with various departments to implement, monitor, and enhance our security controls.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities 👏**
 In this role, you’ll:
   

  

**Governance & Documentation**
* Maintain and update core security documentation, including policies, procedures, and instructions, ensuring they remain current and relevant.
* Identify, collect, and analyse data to track key security performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics, generating reports and dashboards to communicate security performance to stakeholders


**Risk Management**
* Maintain the risk register and support daily risk management activities with growing independence.
* Follow up on the remediation of risks identified in new projects, third-party engagements, and other business initiatives.
* Conduct thorough security posture assessments of new vendors and perform periodic reviews of existing ones.
* Support our 3rd party procurement process.


**Compliance & Controls**
* Monitor the implementation and effectiveness of security controls across the organisation.
* Coordinate and support activities to maintain key security certifications, including PCI-DSS and ISO 27001.
* Coordinate and support the implementation of remediation plans to address identified compliance gaps.
* Provide support in responding to security-related questions during partner due diligence and assist in providing necessary information for cyber insurance renewals.
* Coordinate and support internal audits by providing requested information and addressing audit findings.


**Collaboration & Business Acumen**
* Develop and implement tailored security training and awareness programs for different roles, complementing existing initiatives.
* Contribute to the development and implementation of the Digital Operational Resilience Strategy.
* Understand the business context behind the team's work and make decisions aligned with overall team and company objectives.


**Tooling ⚙️**
* Slack
* G-suite
* Formalize
* Linear
* Vanta


**Qualifications 👑**
* 2 to 4 years of experience in information security governance, risk, or compliance roles.
* Demonstrated experience with compliance frameworks and regulations (e.g., PCI DSS, ISO 27001, GDPR, PSD2, EBA outsourcing and DORA).
* Knowledge of security frameworks (e.g., CIS Controls, NIST CSF).
* Solid understanding of risk assessment methodologies and hands-on experience with risk registers and third-party risk management.
* Experience in coordinating activities for security certifications and audits.
* Ability to develop and track security metrics (KPIs).
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organisational skills.
* Excellent communication skills, comfortable presenting to various stakeholders.
* A proactive and independent worker who is also a strong team player.
* Experience in the financial services or fintech industry is a plus.


**Your people 👥**
 Our team is as ambitious as our amazing customers. We aim high and we move with speed to make our vision a reality. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn’t get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.
   

  

**Your Benefits 😍**
 We’re freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.
   

  

* We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg at least two days per week.
* Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
* Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
* Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
* Stock options. We can’t promise you’ll make a fortune. But we’ll give it our very best shot.
* Vacation. 30 days.
* Private Health insurance. You know. Just in case
* Beautiful offices in central Gothenburg and Stockholm, front row sea view!


 At Juni, we’re building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.

title: Store & Interior Design Manager
description:
**Are you both commercially sharp and design-driven?** 




  





 Do you thrive in a client-facing role where sales meet creativity? Dusty Deco is looking for a Store & Interior Design Manager to lead our Stockholm flagship, drive sales, and bring our interiors to life through styling, clienteling, and design services.
 



  





**About Dusty Deco** 




  





 At Dusty Deco, we create furniture and decor that tell a story, pieces inspired by timeless design and crafted with character. Based in Stockholm, we’ve grown into a lifestyle brand that blends aesthetics, function, and craftsmanship. Every piece in our collection is designed to make a lasting impression.
 



 We’re currently on an exciting high-growth journey, with strong traction across markets and a growing community of design-conscious customers. Joining us now means becoming part of something special, and this role is central to how our brand is experienced.
 



  





**Why Join Us?** 




  




* High-Impact Role – Lead our flagship store, where brand, customer experience, and sales meet.
* Design Meets Sales – Combine your passion for interiors with commercial focus, offering both inspiration and tailored solutions to our clients.
* Creative Environment – Style and curate our store together with our Creative Director, ensuring it always reflects Dusty Deco’s bold yet timeless aesthetic.
* Close-Knit Team – Work with a creative group passionate about design, craftsmanship, and customer experience.



  





**What You’ll Do** 




  





 As our Store & Interior Design Manager, you’ll run the day-to-day of our store while also delivering design services for customers, both in-store and through consultations.
 



  





**Your responsibilities will include:** 




  





**Store Ownership & Sales** 



* Lead daily store operations and performance.
* Drive sales and achieve monthly targets.
* Deliver a premium clienteling experience, from first contact to long-term relationship.



**Interior Design & Styling** 



* Provide interior design consultations in-store, digitally and on-site at clients’ homes.
* Create mood boards, proposals, and product recommendations that convert into sales.
* Own visual merchandising, floor sets, and styling together with Creative Director to ensure the store reflects our design language.



**Customer Experience & Service** 



* Manage customers and professional clients (architects, stylists, etc.).
* Ensure a seamless after-sales experience, coordinating with logistics and back office.



**Commercial & Reporting** 



* Report on sales KPIs and customer insights.
* Turn client feedback into actions that elevate both store and brand.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




  




* **Interior Design & Furniture Experience** 
 – You have worked in the interior design or furniture industry, ideally with a portfolio of projects or styling cases.
* **Styling & Spatial Thinking** 
 – You’re skilled in creating design concepts, mood boards, and floor plans.
* **Commercially Sharp** 
 – You’re target-driven and understand how to turn inspiration into sales. You’re motivated by creating connections that lead to long-term customer relationships and strong results.
* **Customer-Centric** 
 – You excel in building trust and long-term relationships.
* **Organized & Detail-Oriented** 
 – From schedules to proposals, you keep things structured.
* **Languages** 
 – Fluent in Swedish and English.



  





**It's a plus if you bring:** 



* Experience with premium/luxury furniture brands.
* Existing network in the interior design/architecture community.



  





 If you’re excited to combine store leadership with interior design in a fast-growing, design-driven brand, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Senior System Engineer - Medical Device
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

**Your role**
 As a System Engineer you will work for medical devices clients, helping them with new product design and development. You will be creating product documentation right from the conceptual design to the product validation and all the way to product sustaining and handling of design changes.
   

  

**As a System Engineer You Will**
* Incorporate essential operating mechanisms of systems engineering of medical device design and adhere to medical device regulations.
* Participate in identifying and planning tasks, activities, and resource needs related to systems engineering.
* Leverages knowledge of technology, process, and/or therapy domains to drive solutions and product design realization from a systems perspective.
* Defines system requirements, architecture, and interfaces to meet product requirements, risk analysis and industry standards.
* Creates design concepts and research methodologies that best meet current and future customer & business needs for a product or process domain area.
* Conducts system design analysis to select key components and defines control methods; and coordinates build and design integration.
* Understands clinical and user needs and can apply to product realization.
* Works together to support product verification and validation planning, resolution of technical integration issues, and coordinate system testing.
* Demonstrates understanding of and adherence to FDA, ISO and IEC design control procedures, regulations, and standards.
* Drives Change Control Management records as Change owner and ensure timely closure.
* Creates and maintains Design History File elements.
* Conducts design reviews as part of the product development process to ensure customer requirements are met and the designs are manufacture-able, serviceable, and reliable.
* Successfully influences stakeholders and cross-functional team members within the project.


 Systems Engineering and Product Design
   

  

**Your profile**
* A degree in Electrical/Mechanical/Biomedical Engineering (or) related engineering discipline with 6 plus of experience.
* Deep knowledge of systems engineering disciplines and related areas for medical devices (such as Electro-mechanical systems, embedded hardware and software).
* Knowledge of and/or experience of working accordance with regulations, guidelines, and standards such as: EU MDR, US FDA, IEC 60601, ISO 13485, ISO 14971 etc.
* The ability to communicate fluently in spoken and written English.
* A valid work permit for Sweden.


**You As a Person Are**
* Curious and motivated by exciting challenges,
* A person who takes initiatives, is flexible and thrives in a dynamic environment,
* A person who finds it easy to cooperate and communicate with different groups of people,
* Genuinely interested in technology and problem solving, and
* Driven by challenges and personal development.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We support your personal development and offer an education library with more than 250 000 (!) courses and educations and certifications.


**Application**
 As part of our recruitment process, identity verification or background checks may occasionally be conducted.
   

  

**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion. Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Administrative Assistant at Combat Systems
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Ready to find your path? Try new things. Share experiences. And discover what you truly enjoy.*
 Your role
   

  

 As administrative assistant to our team based in Solna/Järfälla, you’ll play an essential role in supporting the management team and all who work within the departments Portfolio and 9LV Product, Marketing and Sales and Strategy. You’ll be the go-to person for a range of administrative tasks that keep our operations running smoothly. From organizing meetings and conferences to personnel admin, office supply orders, and maintaining a positive work environment, your contributions will be crucial to our success. You will also collaborate with all other assistants within the business unit. Over time, we expect you to learn about our operations and business and be able to take on more and more qualified tasks.
   

  

 What You’ll Be Doing
   

  

* Coordinating meetings, conferences, and travel arrangements for the team.
* Managing team calendars and keeping track of key appointments, deadlines and reminders for the team.
* Ordering office supplies and other equipment needed by the team
* Handling emails and calls by redirecting them appropriately and communicating important messages to the team.
* Organizing files and documents, ensuring easy access to important information
* Documenting meetings and following up on action items
* Organizing team events
* Assist with onboarding of new employees
* Maintaining an organized and efficient work environment


 Your profile
   

  

 We’re looking for someone who is highly organized with a keen eye for details. You should thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment and be quick to learn new tools and systems. Communication is key, so you’ll need to be comfortable interacting in both Swedish and English, and be able to express yourself clearly, both in writing and verbally. You should be just as comfortable taking the initiative on tasks independently as you are collaborating with others to get things done as a team.
   

  

* You have at least one year of experience working in an administrative role
* You are proficient in using various administrative tools and a quick learner
* Previous experience collaborating with or providing support to Sales, Strategy, or Product Management departments is an advantage


 You will bring a proactive attitude and the desire to learn and grow within your role. If you’re ready to make an impact, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

 What you will be part of
   

  

 Explore a wealth of possibilities. Take on challenges, create smart inventions, and grow beyond. This is a place for curious minds, brave pioneers, and everyone in between. Together, we achieve the extraordinary, each bringing our unique perspectives. Your part matters.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 26,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

 Your primary workplace will be our new office in Solna Strand, but you will also be required to work onsite at our office in Järfälla occasionally.

title: Head of Communications BNEW
description:
**Join our Team**
**About This Opportunity**
 We are seeking a senior communications leader to shape and deliver a world-class communications strategy for Ericsson’s Business Area Networks (BNEW). As Head of Communications, you will lead a high-performing team responsible for executive communications, media and analyst relations, strategic narrative development, external positioning, and employee communications. This role combines strategic vision with hands-on delivery and requires close collaboration with senior executives and deep sector knowledge of telecom, cloud-native networking and enterprise B2B ecosystems.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Serve as senior communications advisor to the Head of Ericsson Networks and other senior leaders: own key narratives, craft speeches, talking points and briefing materials.
* Coach and prepare executives for public appearances, investor and analyst engagements, and internal AEMs; manage executive visibility across owned, earned and paid channels.
* Define and deploy BNEW’s strategic narrative to position Ericsson Networks as a leader in 5G, 6G, private networks and cloud-native network solutions.
* Translate technical and commercial priorities into clear, audience-specific messages for customers, partners, analysts and regulators.
* Lead media and analyst relations with proactive and reactive strategies; build strong relationships with global and regional reporters and analyst firms; manage crisis and issue communications with speed and accuracy.
* Design and deliver integrated internal communications (AEMs, intranet, leader communications, change comms) to engage and align employees with strategy and product roadmaps.
* Lead, mentor and grow a cross-disciplinary communications team; set objectives, measure impact, manage budget and agency relationships; ensure agile delivery and governance across regions and corporate stakeholders.


**You will bring**
* 12+ years of progressive communications experience, including at least 5 years in a senior leadership role (head of function or similar).
* Proven experience in enterprise B2B, telecoms, technology or adjacent sectors, with demonstrable understanding of network technology, service models and industry dynamics.
* Strong track record in executive communications, reputation management and global media/analyst relations.
* Experience leading cross-functional teams and working closely with C-suite stakeholders.
* Exceptional writing, storytelling and messaging skills with the ability to translate complex technical topics into clear business narratives.
* Crisis communications experience and the ability to perform confidently under pressure.
* Relevant degree in communications, journalism, business or equivalent experience; strategic communications certifications are a plus.


**Application**
 We look forward to your application with CV in English. Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail.
   

  

 Last day to apply: 25th of September 2025
   

  

 If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Raheleh Rouhani, Sr. Talent Acquisition Partner at raheleh.rouhani@ericsson.com
   

  

 Location: Preferably Stockholm, Sweden or alternatively CET (+/- 1) time zone with regular 1-2x month presence in Stockholm.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 771626

title: Account Manager, Sweden Public Sector
description:
**Description**
 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

 As Account Executive you will have the exciting opportunity to help drive the growth and shape the future of an emerging technology and increase adoption and market segment presence of AWS in the Swedish Public Sector.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will possess both a sales / account management and technical background that enables them to drive an engagement at the executive level as well as with software developers and IT architects and have gained experience in the Public Sector in particular with Central Government. You will be a self-starter who is prepared to develop and execute against a territory coverage plan and consistently deliver results.
   

  

 You are an exceptionally strong and creative thinker who thrives in a team environment and embraces all aspects of selling and who is prepared to develop and execute against a territory coverage plan and consistently deliver on targets. You enjoy working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Effectively engage C-level business & technical executives within the assigned Customers
* Leverage executive Customer relationships to build trust with AWS leadership & accelerate strategic enterprise opportunities to ensure customer satisfaction
* Build/Own the strategic plan for the Customer you own, to drive business growth objectives
* Articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services
* Achieve goals and strategic objectives including revenue, pipeline and repeatable solutions
* Drive Customer strategy using industry vertical solutions, business transformation initiatives and deliver high quality Customer outcomes
* Work with cross functional teams & Partners to create and execute on strategic business plans, practice development and marketing, to execute achievement against Customers goals
* Help to drive business growth and expansion in a defined territory
* Manage numerous Customers concurrently & long-term
* Accelerate customer adoption & develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts
* Travel as necessary


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Significant Account management experience for Enterprise and Public Sector Customers in the IT industry
* Substantial technology related sales, business development or sales engineering/consulting experience, gained within Enterprise and Public Sector Customers
* Strong presentation skills and ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences
* BA/BS degree or equivalent experience required
* Strong verbal and written communications skills; fluent in Swedish and English


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Strong knowledge and focus on the Swedish Central Government
* A technical background in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus.
* IaaS/PaaS/SaaS/Cloud experience
* Business acumen and passion
* Proven track record of taking ownership and successfully delivering results in a fast-paced, dynamic environment


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A3037083

title: Release Train Engineer
description:
**Att jobba som Release Train Engineer**
 Som Release Train Engineer inom IT bank kliver du in i en strategiskt viktig nyckelroll i hjärtat av vår digitala utveckling. Du blir ansvarig för ett av våra SAFe-tåg, ett tåg som omfattar 15 tvärfunktionella team och flera värdeströmmar med både IT och verksamhet representerade. Du har en central roll i att skapa struktur, stöd och engagemang för att möjliggöra en effektiv leveransrytm med hög kvalitet och stabila banklösningar.
   

  

 Arbetet innebär att coacha och stötta både team och ledning i frågor som rör arbetssätt, leverans, samarbete och kultur. Du ansvarar för planering, facilitering av PI-planeringar, koordinering av beroenden och ser till att vårt agila flöde optimeras och utvecklas kontinuerligt.
   

  

 Ditt uppdrag är tätt kopplat till både bankens portföljstyrning och övriga SAFe-tåg inom Skandia. Du samarbetar med produktledning, arkitekter, produktägare och Scrum Masters, och spelar en viktig roll i att säkerställa att banken utvecklas i takt med hela koncernen. Du kommer även att delta i interna ledarforum och vara en aktiv del i vårt gemensamma RTE-team där erfarenheter, strategier och visioner delas för att stärka hela vår leveransförmåga.
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du att rapportera till chef IT bank.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Ser vi att du har några års erfarenhet av att arbeta som release train engineer med beprövad ledarskapserfarenhet. Du är van att arbeta enligt SAFe (t.ex. RTE certifierad eller SPC) och har god förankring i lean-agila värderingar och arbetssätt. Ett grundkrav är att du kommunicerar både i tal och skrift svenska och engelska flytande.
   

  

 Meriterande för rollen är om du arbetat inom bank- och försäkringsbranschen samt att du tidigare har arbetat som agil coach.
   

  

 Som person är du både driven och framåtriktad. Du har en god förmåga att hantera både strategiska och operativa uppgifter. Vi ser att du kan arbeta både med struktur och målmedvetenhet. Ditt ledarskap kännetecknas av ett inkluderande och coachande förhållningssätt och du trivs i en roll där du får kombinera engagemang, analys och samarbete. Du är nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap för hos oss lär vi av varandra.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Patrik Anderson på patrik.anderson@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Harald Brehmer Talent Acquisition Partner på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Optimization Client Services Analyst
description:
**About The Role**
**Optimization Client Services Analyst - OSTTRA**
 The Client Services Analyst is responsible for delivering the triReduce and triBalance service to clients. That means running triReduce and triBalance cycles and making sure they execute successfully. In addition, the role involves supporting clients, testing output from Web and Financial Development and supporting the Sales team.
   

  

**Principal Accountabilities**
 Support and manage Service delivery for triReduce/triBalance cycles:
   

  

* Manage clients from start to finish
* Receive and verify client data
* Value and verify Mtm and risk for clients OTC portfolios
* Setup and verify risk constraints and tolerances
* Run the compression and optimisation algorithm
* Ensure banks execute the results from triReduce and triBalance cycles
* Handle client requests such as user account management, simulations, training and general support


**Support Client Onboarding For TriReduce And TriBalance**
* Setup new accounts and users, test and verify client data, run simulations and present results.


**Skills And Software Requirements**
* Banking and Finance – Basic knowledge of OTC derivatives and Options in one or many of the following asset classes Rates, FX, Credit, Equity and Commodities
* IT/Technical - This role must have basic IT skills including the ability to work with raw client data using editors and spreadsheet tools. Basic knowledge of MySQL databases and basic Python programming is beneficial but not a requirement.
* Ability to engage and communicate with clients and internal stakeholders in a number of different regions


 OSTTRA is committed to offering a competitive total rewards package for our employees that recognizes their contributions to the business and reflects our long-term investment in their future.
   

  

**About OSTTRA**
*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.*
 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
   

  

 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
   

  

 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
**Benefits**
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.

* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries

 If you receive an email from a spglobalind.com domain or any other regionally based domains, it is a scam and should be reported to reportfraud@spglobal.com. S&P Global never requires any candidate to pay money for job applications, interviews, offer letters, “pre-employment training” or for equipment/delivery of equipment. Stay informed and protect yourself from recruitment fraud by reviewing our guidelines, fraudulent domains, and how to report suspicious activity here.

 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

title: Senior Product Designer, AI & Learning
description:
Learning is one of the newest verticals on Spotify. We believe that we can make a real difference in how people learn and upskill, with our massive consumer and creator scale, personalisation technology and global brand love. This will be the next big step-change for Spotify after music, podcasts, and audiobooks.
   

  

 We are looking for a Senior Product Designer to work alongside a world-class R&D team and key decision-makers. This role requires a broad remit, and we are looking for someone who thrives as a generalist builder – combining expertise in product design and AI.
   

  

 Who You Are
   

  

* You are passionate about Learning and Education: You possess a genuine enthusiasm for the space of learning and education. You are driven by your desire to create impactful experiences that transform how people learn now and in the future.
* You’ve shipped products that people love: You know what it takes to transform ideas and concepts into well-crafted products that make a difference to people and the business.
* You demonstrate clarity of thought: You can cut through ambiguity and get to the heart of things. You can balance creativity with pragmatism and drive principled decision-making across the product development process.
* You care about Design excellence: You are adept at foundational design principles and the ability to apply them to create exceptional user experiences. You have a discerning eye for visual and content design, typography and layout – consistently delivering high-quality, bar-raising work.
* You’ve experience with building AI-first workflows and products: You have a strong understanding and hands-on familiarity with AI tools, evals, and the unique challenges and opportunities of designing AI-driven products.
* You’re growth and impact-minded: You can operate in fast-paced entrepreneurial environments and know how to stay adaptable to changes and pivots – using change as an opportunity to grow.


 What You'll Do
   

  

* You'll be responsible for design quality and cohesion of learning-related products across mobile and web.
* Invent the future through rapid prototyping: You’ll demonstrate prototyping as a vehicle for exploring, testing, and creating momentum for our forward-looking strategies and ideas. You know how to use new-generation prototyping tools to get from ideas to findings quickly.
* Bring a human-centric mentality in everything you do: You are relentlessly curious about understanding the needs, motivations, and behaviors of people we’re designing for, especially in the context of AI. You'll be a champion for user-centered design principles, prioritizing usability, accessibility, inclusivity, and ethical considerations when building with AI.
* Inspire and influence through compelling storytelling: You will leverage the power of stories, narratives, and strategic positioning artifacts to drive impactful change and alignment across the team.
* Be ultra-collaborative: You’ll work everyday in deep-partnership with tech, product, and insights colleagues, to brainstorm, build, and drive the project forward, humanizing complex technology into valuable user experiences.
* Define and design AI interaction patterns: Develop innovative interaction models, feedback mechanisms, and error handling strategies specific to AI-driven features, ensuring transparency and user control.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home. We ask that you come in 2-3 times per week.
* The team is based in Sweden and the UK. We are looking for someone who can work in the EMEA time zone.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Data Engineer Content - Schibsted
description:
At Schibsted, we are reimagining how data powers high-quality journalism. Our mission is to build a best-in-class data ecosystem that fuels editorial insight, optimizes content workflows, and helps newsrooms work smarter—not harder.
   

  

 We are now hiring a Data Engineer to join our growing Content Data team. In this role, you'll help develop the data infrastructure that supports everything from article creation to content distribution and performance tracking. You’ll make it easier for editors, product managers, and analysts to understand what resonates with audiences—and why.
   

  

 Based in Stockholm, you’ll work in a collaborative, impact-driven environment where data is central to how we create, measure, and evolve content experiences across the Nordics. You'll contribute to systems that support automation, metadata standardization, video and audio analytics, and cross-brand editorial insights.
   

  

**What will you do in this role?**
 This is a hands-on and high-impact role, where you’ll work across the full data lifecycle—from infrastructure to insight. You will:
   

  

* Develop ETL/ELT pipelines to integrate large datasets from diverse sources into centralized data warehouses, data lakes, or other storage systems
* Integrate diverse data sources (structured and unstructured), enabling consistent, high-quality datasets for analytics and machine learning
* Build systems that power real-time personalization, editorial performance, A/B testing, audience engagement, and more
* Implement and maintain tracking solutions and event pipelines to ensure trustworthy data across products
* Collaborate closely with analysts, data scientists, product teams, and stakeholders to ensure data products align with business goals
* Support lighter analysis tasks when needed and help make data accessible and actionable through tools like Tableau, Amplitude, Kilkaya, and Streamlit
* For senior roles: Lead complex data architecture work, guide standards across teams, and mentor peers


**We are looking for the following experience:**
* 3+ years of experience in a professional software/data engineering role
* Proficiency in Python, Scala, or Java
* Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with data modeling in analytical environments
* Hands-on experience with modern data pipelines and orchestration tools (e.g. dbt, Airflow)
* Familiarity with cloud infrastructure (especially AWS) and infrastructure-as-code (e.g. Terraform)
* Understanding of agile workflows and software engineering best practices (e.g. version control, CI/CD)
* Bonus: experience working with event data, editorial tools, or media analytics


**Our tech stack:**
* Data platform: AWS, Snowflake, S3, Redshift
* Transformation and orchestration: dbt, Airflow, Prefect
* Programming and scripting: Python, SQL, R
* Exploration and delivery: Tableau, Amplitude, Streamlit, Kilkaya


**Who you are:**
 We believe you are independent and structured, with a strong drive to make an impact. You are communicative and collaborative, thriving at the intersection of tech, product, business, and editorial. Your curiosity and business mindset help you see how data can be turned into real value, and you are confident in bringing clarity and transparency to complex environments.
   

  

**Why we enjoy working here:**
 At Schibsted, we value openness, curiosity, and collaboration. You’ll be part of a diverse, inclusive workplace that encourages bold thinking and continuous learning. Our work directly supports public interest journalism—and we take that responsibility seriously.
   

  

 Whether you’re enabling better content decisions, driving user personalization, or shaping experimentation at scale, your contributions will help shape the future of digital media in the Nordics.
   

  

 You will be joining a collaborative, impact-driven team that works across disciplines like technology, product, and editorial. We believe in structured yet flexible ways of working, balancing clear ownership with strong teamwork. Curiosity, openness, and a drive to create value through data are at the heart of how we operate. We support each other, celebrate continuous learning, and are passionate about turning complex challenges into meaningful solutions for our users and brands.
   

  

**Application process** 
 : Please apply for this position by sharing your CV with us and a letter of motivation. You are welcome to write it in Swedish. Selection of candidates takes place on an ongoing basis during the process.

title: Applikationsspecialist
description:
Svenska kraftnät är en nyckelaktör i energiomställningen. Vår IT-division växer för att möjliggöra en fördubblad elproduktion och en fossilfri framtid. Med den senaste tekniken ökar vi både infrastrukturens kapacitet och utvecklingstakten inom digitalisering och processer.
   

  

 Vi söker en driftnära applikationsspecialist till vårt viktiga förvaltningsobjekt Elberedskap och Säkerhet, vilket innehåller verksamhetskritiska system med höga krav på tillgänglighet, säkerhet och funktion.
