company_description: Advancing a sustainable energy future for all

title: Automation Engineer, Software R&D
description:
**Bli del av något större**


Är du redo att ta din potential till nästa nivå och göra verklig skillnad inom Life Science, diagnostik och bioteknik?


På Cytiva, ett av Danahers 15 dotterbolag, räddar vårt arbete liv. Hos oss blir du del av en kultur som präglas av gemenskap och tillhörighet där ditt unika perspektiv spelar roll. Med hjälp av Danaher Business System omvandlar vi idéer till konkreta lösningar.


Att arbeta på Cytiva innebär att ligga i framkant av att utveckla nya sätt att förbättra människors hälsa. Våra kunder bedriver allt från grundläggande biologisk forskning till att utveckla innovativa vacciner, nya läkemedel och cell- och genterapier.


På Cytiva får du chansen att utvecklas tillsammans med oss och göra verklig skillnad för människor världen över. Ta chansen att bli del av något större.


Läs mer om Danaher Business System som gör allt möjligt.


Är du automationsingenjör och vill bidra med din kunskap till Life Science i Uppsala? Har du erfarenhet av automation med PLC-programmering och letar efter ett kompetent och välkomnande team som backar upp dig hela vägen? Då kan detta vara nästa utmaning för dig!


Just nu söker vi dig med bakgrund inom automation och PLC-programmering till Downstream R&D Software på Cytiva i Uppsala. Som automationsingenjör hos oss blir du del av ett team som utvecklar mjukvara för styrning och övervakning av våra kromatografisystem som används inom biomedicinsk forskning och läkemedelsproduktion.

**Vilka blir dina arbetsuppgifter?**


I rollen som automationsingenjör jobbar du tillsammans med ditt team i en dynamisk och agil utvecklingsmiljö. Du tillför teamet värdefull kompetens inom automation och har ett nära samarbete med kollegor med andra kompetenser där du är involverad i hela utvecklingsprocessen. Du deltar i analys, design och utveckling av nya funktioner och produkter, stöttar i tekniska utredningar och med avancerad kundsupport.

*Du kommer att:*

* Programmera PLC från Rockwell och eventuellt från andra tillverkare samt utveckla mjukvara för mikroprocessorbaserade plattformar.
* Utveckla styrsystem.
* Arbeta i utvecklingsmiljön Studio 5000 och andra liknande verktyg.
* Bidra till teknisk dokumentaton.

**Vem är du****?**


Vi söker dig som har driv och en passion för teknikutveckling, med några enstaka eller flera års erfarenhet. Du engageras av nya utmaningar, är nyfiken på ny teknik, är trygg i din kompetens och trivs med att samarbeta för att nå resultat.

*Vi söker dig som har:*

* MSc/BSc-examina inom Software Engineering, Automation Engineering, annan relevant ingenjörsutbildning eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Erfarenhet av eller kunskap om PLC-programmering och motsvarande verktyg.
* God samarbetsförmåga och trygghet i att driva uppgifter framåt på egen hand.
* God analytisk förmåga och intresse för teknisk problemlösning.
* Förståelse för elkonstruktion och fältkommunikation.
* Kommunicerar flytande i tal och skrift både på svenska och engelska.

*Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:*

* Rockwell och UNICORN
* Industriella fältbussar, t ex EtherNet/IP
* Inbyggd mjukvara på mikroprocessorbaserade plattformar
* Mjukvaruutveckling och dess livscykel
* Vill utvecklas inom C#/.NET
* Versionshantering
* Produktutveckling
* Agila arbetsmetoder
* Kvalitetssystem och långsiktig kvalitet


Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid den ansökandes personlighet och motivation.

**Varför Cytiva?**


Oavsett din roll, ger vi dig ett syfte och en utmaning varje arbetsdag. Vi är ett glatt gäng som är stolta över vår goda stämning och roliga samarbete. Du kommer att uppleva närheten till ditt team och projekt samtidigt som du har det globala företagets styrka i ryggen.


Vi tror stenhårt på balans mellan arbete och fritid. Till våra förmåner räknas friskvårdstimme, eget gym och egen idrottshall, egen personalrestaurang med subventionerade priser samt innovativt klimat med tid för kompetensutveckling och öppenhet för egna idéer. Som Uppsalabo kommer du att kunna cykla till jobbet! Hållbarhet ligger oss varmt om hjärtat och vem vet – du kanske kan bidra till detta?


Om du drivs av att göra världen till en bättre plats genom vetenskap och medicin kommer du att känna dig hemma här. Är du flexibel, nyfiken och envis är du rätt person. Trivs du dessutom i en global kultur, kan detta vara platsen för din fortsatta karriär.


För frågor rörande tjänsten, kontakta rekryterande chef Petter Lönnstedt - petter.lonnstedt@cytiva.com.


#LI-HJ2


#LI-Onsite


Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.


For more information, visit www.danaher.com.
company_description: Cytiva is a global provider of technologies and services that advance and accelerate the development and manufacture of therapeutics, addressing urgent needs and helping save patient lives.

title: Lead Engineer/GDL - Wireless Hardware
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 5**+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

  

Rollbeskrivning:

### **Lead Engineer / GDL – Wireless Hardware (Automotive Industry)**


We are currently looking for a **Lead Engineer / Group Design Leader (GDL)** with a focus on **Wireless Hardware** to join our client, a well-known player in the automotive sector.

#### **About the Company**


Our client is a global leader in the automotive industry, committed to digital transformation and creating a seamless, connected customer experience. With a strong focus on safety, innovation, and sustainability, they are developing next-generation mobility solutions.

#### **About the Team**


You will be part of a Wireless Hardware team responsible for developing connectivity products that enable an always-connected vehicle experience. These technologies include **5G communication**, **telematics**, **BLE**, **GNSS**, **SDARS**, and **TPMS**.


This team contributes to the development of premium connected vehicles and works in close collaboration with internal stakeholders and global partners.

#### **Role Overview**


As **Lead Engineer / GDL**, you will oversee hardware development for connectivity systems and manage supplier collaboration to ensure requirements, timelines, and cost targets are met.


Your key responsibilities will include:

* Leading a cross-functional team of hardware engineers and software responsible
* Managing technical development activities at suppliers
* Gathering and defining technical requirements from multiple stakeholders
* Ensuring that suppliers accept and deliver on agreed technical scopes
* Reviewing test and validation results in cooperation with suppliers
* Coordinating internal interfaces such as attributes, mechanical integration, and software development
* Creating and following up on project plans to ensure delivery to production and aftermarket

#### **Who You Are**


You are a proactive and structured engineer with a background in product development within the automotive industry. You thrive in a collaborative environment and take ownership of your work. You are passionate about technology and motivated to drive progress in connected vehicle systems.

#### **Qualifications**

* B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electronics, Computer Science, Automation, or a related field
* Experience in automotive product development (hardware/software/integration/testing)
* Experience with diagnostics, component ownership, or release to production is a plus
* Strong interpersonal and organizational skills
* Self-driven, adaptable, and committed to team success
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)

**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Mechanical Design Engineer
description:
**To one of our customers in Lund we are looking for Mechanical Design Engineers.**

**Scope of the assignment**

* Integrate components designed in our partner facilities and manage their integration into the Master CAD model
* Participate directly in the system assembly, machine installation and relevant operations: Activities and work can take place on surface assembly halls (laboratories).
* Generate, maintain and update 2D drawings in CATIA environment and interact/archive them in CHESS (the ESS in-house CAD management software tool).
* Generate 2D design from 3D input.
* Generate 3D model from 2D input.
* Generate 2D and 3D from Requirements input.
* Generation and updates of conceptual, draft, detailed and manufacturing 2D drawings (and 3D models) in CATIA V6.
* Produce, update and review technical documentation.
* Provide installation coordination on site, Generate 2D installation drawings and documentation.
* Follow-up manufacturing of components, monitor production performance and conduct engineering quality and acceptance inspections.
* Document and present your work as appropriate.
* Reviewer responsibility in the Mechanical Engineering discipline, drawings, and engineering packages.
* Review 2D drawing according to mechanical standardization norms and codes for but not limited to GPS tolerancing, ISO, etc.

**Required education background and professional experience**

* Higher Technical or University engineering degree in mechanical engineering or other closely equivalent engineering degree
* Knowledge of basic mechanical engineering
* Minimum 5 years of CAD mechanical design engineering experience
* Minimum 3 years of working experience in CATIA design
* Experience with design maturity, versioning and release
* Previous work experience in scientific facility is a bonus.
* Experience with Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing and its application to production drawings
* Experience and knowledge of maintenance drawings and installation drawings (also industrial) will be an asset.
* Experience and knowledge of technical documentation and configuration management will be an asset.
* Relevant experience in designing mechanical apparatuses fulfilling specific needs for accelerator and detector environments will be an asset.
* Engineering experience on any of the following technologies: radiation background, vacuum, pressure, gas flow, magnetic field, low-frequency radiofrequency, high temperature, cryogenic, or electrical and electronics will be considered an asset.

title: Certification & Compliance Engineer
description:
Compliance Engineer
  
We are looking for a skilled Compliance Engineer to join our Certification & Compliance (C&C) team. This global department consists of around 35 professionals located in Sweden, France, USA, Brazil, and India. Our mission is to manage certification and compliance activities to ensure that products meet all applicable regulatory requirements for power, emissions, CO₂, OBD, EMC, and electrical safety—both at the time of certification and throughout the product lifecycle. These activities are essential to delivering sustainable products, minimizing compliance risks, and contributing to a better environment.
  
The Sweden-based team consists of around 10 experienced engineers with strong backgrounds in engine development, verification, certification, and regulatory compliance. It is a collaborative and supportive group, providing an excellent forum for knowledge sharing and professional growth.
  
What you will do
  
As a Compliance Engineer, you will play an important role in ensuring that products remain compliant during their maintenance phase.
  
  

**Your responsibilities will include:**  

Monitoring and analyzing logged vehicle data from the field to ensure ongoing compliance
  
Preparing compliance reports and updates on a regular basis
  
Coordinating activities within the C&C department related to product updates in the maintenance phase
  
Leading compliance evaluations of product updates in collaboration with Regulation Specialists and Certification Leaders
  
Supporting certification updates and documentation as needed
  
  

This role combines regulatory knowledge, data analysis, and leadership skills with an understanding of software release processes. It also requires regular collaboration with colleagues across multiple functions and global locations.
  
Who you are
  
You are curious, detail-oriented, and motivated to contribute to compliance, sustainability, and continuous improvement. You thrive in a global environment and enjoy combining your analytical mindset with strong communication and collaboration skills.
  
  

**To succeed in this role, you should have:**  

A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering (or equivalent experience in the automotive sector)
  
At least 4 years of experience in data analysis and software release management (preferably within the automotive industry)
  
Strong skills in data analysis tools such as Python, SQL, Azure, and Power BI
  
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (Swedish is a plus)
  
A structured, analytical approach and the ability to work effectively with complex data
  
Personal integrity, courage, and a positive, proactive attitude
  
  

If you are looking for a role where you can apply your technical expertise while contributing to a more sustainable and compliant transport industry, this opportunity could be the right fit for you.
  
Please note that the start of this job is ASAP so you need to be located in Sweden and available for start right away in order to apply.
  
Looking forward to meeting you.

title: Performance & Calibration Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Development Engineer with a strong focus on engine calibration. This role requires both practical experience in calibration and a solid understanding of combustion theory and engine development.
  
About the Role
  
The Industrial Development and Calibration function within product development is responsible for testing and optimizing both hardware and software related to performance, emissions, and durability of industrial combustion engines.
  
As a Development Engineer, you will be responsible for delivering test and optimization tasks as part of a project team. Your work will range from sensor linearization to preparing complete engine software settings for production.
  
Main Responsibilities
  
Perform calibration and optimization tasks for combustion engines (diesel and alternative fuels)
  
Deliver engine-specific optimization for assigned projects
  
Use advanced tools such as ENE and DoE for screening and calibration
  
Work with ATI Vision (calibration and data acquisition), DTECS (development tool for embedded control systems), and Concerto (data post-processing and evaluation)
  
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders, contributing to product development and innovation
  
  

Who You Are
  
We are looking for a team player with a passion for product development, particularly in testing and optimizing combustion engines. Strong networking skills and the ability to work across teams are highly valued.
  
Requirements
  
Proven engine calibration experience
  
Master of Science degree (or equivalent technical experience)
  
Several years of experience in combustion engine development
  
Strong knowledge of fundamental combustion theory
  
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
  
Valid driver’s license (car)
  
  

This is a fantastic opportunity to contribute to advanced engine development while being part of a collaborative and supportive team.
  
Looking forward to meeting you.

title: Mechanical Designer
description:
**Job number**
SE00005


**Company**
Morgårdshammar AB


**Country**
Sweden


**Location**
Smedjebacken


**Job family**
ENGINEERING
**About us**
------------


Morgårdshammar AB has been known for its innovations in the rolling mill industry since 1856, having developed several patented products over the years. Since 1987, the company has been part of the Danieli Group – one of the world’s largest suppliers of equipment and technical support to the steel manufacturing industry, with an annual turnover exceeding €4 billion.



Headquartered in Italy, the Danieli Group operates in 28 countries, offering outstanding opportunities for personal development and exciting challenges.


**We are now looking for an engineer with an interest in heavy industry and steel structures to join our team in Morgårdshammar, Smedjebacken!**

Do you have a technical mindset and enjoy a coordinating role working closely with our sales team? Would you like to work in a global environment focused on sales support and customized technical solutions? Then this could be right for you!


**Responsibilities**
--------------------


Are you at the beginning of your engineering career and eager to help shape the future of industrial solutions? Do you enjoy having a central role working closely with customers, sales teams, and internal technical experts?



In this role, you’ll grow within a global industrial environment and work with tasks such as:


* Updating old drawings to meet modern standards
* Creating documentations and technical solutions to support our sales teams
* Reviewing drawings to assist purchasing before placing orders
* Supporting the purchasing department with practical solutions when discrepancies in goods are noted


This position will expand our technical team from 4 to 5 members.


**Technical Requirements**
--------------------------


* Has an engineering degree, preferably in mechanical engineering
* Is curious, solution-oriented, and takes responsibility
* Wants to grow in a role where technology and communication are central
* Is structured, communicative and proactive
* Speaks and writes English fluently

  



Your communication skills, engagement and ability to learn are more important than prior experience in engineering or design.


**Merits:**


* Post-secondary education in economics
* Experience with ERP and CRM-systems, preferably SAP
* Language skills in Swedish, Finnish, Italian or German
* Experience with Autodesk software


**Soft Skills**
---------------


* Service-minded and cooperative
* Thorough and responsible
* Skilled at building relationships internally and externally
* Enjoys a role with many points of contact

title: Software Test Automation Engineer
description:
As a global technology leader with over 150 years of innovation, we are driving the development of premium solutions that optimize performance, safety and sustainability in the manufacturing industry. Atlas Copco Industrial Technique’s systems empower global industry users to control assembly processes.  

We are looking for a Software Test Engineer. Join our team and enjoy a supportive work environment with opportunities for professional growth and flexible working hours.

**Your role**  

As a test developer in our team, you design, implement and run test scripts that regression test software intended for products that support an automated assembly industry. You work with complex and large embedded industrial systems in cross-functional and agile teams, and are involved in all steps of the process - from first idea to product. The solutions we develop are used to improve efficiency, quality, safety, speed, ergonomics and environmental performance.  

**Location:** Stockholm, Nacka  

**To succeed you need**

* You hold a masters degree in science within mechatronics/computer science or equivalent and have experience in automatic software test design, programming in Python and from complex or large embedded systems. Preferably you hold an ISTQB certification.
* You can work with test within all abstraction levels in embedded software from low level driver control to application level.
* You are fluent in English.

**In return we offer**


At Atlas Copco, we value your work and who you are. We believe that the one closest to the problem is the one closest to the solution. We have a collaborative and supportive work environment embracing different perspectives. Our internal job market unlocks opportunities for you to explore and to develop new skills.


We are looking forward to your application via our job site!


**Uniting curious minds**  

Behind every innovative solution, there are people working together to transform the future. With careers sparked by initiative and lifelong learning, we unite curious minds, and you could be one of them.
company_description: Atlas Copco provides compressed air and gas equipment, industrial power tools, construction equipment, and industrial vacuum equipment, as well as service and maintenance. www.atlascopco.com

title: Enterprise Pre-Sales Engineer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. Our growth is made possible by the dedicated team of hundreds behind the scenes. From software developers and product managers to designers and strategists, Team UI is driven to achieve our common goal: Rethinking IT. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons - all while shaping the future of connectivity.  

  

**About the position:**


We’re seeking a highly motivated Enterprise Technical Pre-Sales Engineer to join our growing sales team. This is a unique opportunity to work across Ubiquiti’s expanding ecosystem—including routing, switching, security, SD-WAN, cameras, door access control, and other emerging UniFi technologies. You’ll be instrumental in helping customers design, deploy, and scale their networks while shaping the future of our product development through direct collaboration with R&D.


This role is ideal for someone who thrives on solving complex problems, has a strong grasp of enterprise networking and physical security, and is excited to be on the front lines of innovation.  

  

***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***

**Responsibilities:**

* Engage with enterprise customers to understand and architect solutions across networking (routing, switching, firewall, SD-WAN), physical security (video surveillance, access control), and other emerging UniFi technologies
* Create detailed system designs and technical proposals for large-scale deployments
* Deliver technical demos, webinars, and hands-on trainings both remotely and on-site
* Translate customer needs into clear, actionable feedback for R&D—explaining not just the “what,” but the “why” and “how”
* Stay on the cutting edge of industry trends and evaluate how they intersect with Ubiquiti’s roadmap
* Build and maintain lab environments to test, learn, and validate configurations hands-on
* Travel as needed to industry events, trade shows, and key customer sites

**Requirements:**

* 3+ years in the enterprise networking or physical security industry, ideally in a pre-sales, systems engineering, or technical consulting role
* Strong knowledge of networking fundamentals and security architectures, including UniFi or comparable platforms
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills—comfortable engaging with both technical and executive stakeholders
* Self-starter who thrives in fast-paced, dynamic environments with minimal oversight
* Passion for independent learning and a drive to “lab” and explore new technologies
* Ability to connect customer insights to product evolution, helping drive innovation at scale

**Benefits:*** International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests


***Please note that a background check will be conducted in the final stage of the recruitment process***

title: Test och QA-konsulter till qbox
description:
**Vi söker test- och QA-konsulter till qbox**

* ***Gillar du av att arbeta på ett mindre, varmt och nischat konsultbolag inom test och QA?***
* ***Trivs du av att känna tillhörighet i en tight specialistgrupp inom test och QA?***
* ***Troligen har du varit på större konsultbolag tidigare och söker en trevligare kontext att utvecklas vidare i? Alternativt är du frilansare idag, och saknar kollegor och en tillhörighet.***

***Då tror vi att qbox är helt rätt för dig. Läs gärna vidare!***

**qbox** passar den som vill kombinera det bästa av två världar – trygghet i en anställning och friheten i ett frilansupplägg. Här är du aldrig ensam, och alltid fri att välja lön, uppdrag, omfattning, utbildning utifrån dina preferenser.

**Varför qbox?**  

qbox startades 2010 av konsulter som själva längtade efter något mer än att vara ett enmansbolag. Här får du:


* **Frihet** – du styr själv över uppdrag, schema och utveckling.
* **Trygghet** – fast anställning, garantilön och trygghetskonto.
* **Gemenskap** – vi bygger ett hem för frilansare med stark tillhörighet och nätverk, regelbundna möten och resor.
* **Utveckling** – vi stöttar varandra i sälj, kompetensutveckling och att bygga din konsult-persona.


qbox är framtidens konsultbolag för test och kvalitetssäkring. Våra konsulter är seniora, välrenommerade och omtyckta specialister som valt bort traditionella arbetsgivare för något mer personligt: en gemenskap med likasinnade, där öppenhet, ärlighet och kompetens går före hierarkier och prestige.

**Rollen**  

Vi söker dig som, likväl som oss, brinner för **test och QA**, oavsett form. Hos oss finns både plats för dig som är **tekniskt driven** inom test automatisering och CI/CD, och för dig som är mer **människoorienterad** med fokus på processer och ledarskap.


På qbox har vi konsulter som bl.a. arbetar med:

* Testutvecklare / SDET (Software Development Engineer in Test)
* QA Engineer / Test Engineer
* Test Lead / Test Manager
* Performance Engineer
* Kvalitetscoach

**Vem är du?**

* Du har flera års erfarenhet inom test/QA, gärna både tekniskt och organisatoriskt.
* Du är nyfiken, framåtlutad och gillar att ta ansvar.
* Du har ett entreprenöriellt driv och gillar friheten i att få välja själv och ta ansvar för din egen utveckling.
* Du trivs i ett sammanhang där alla hjälps åt, med både försäljning och kompetens delning.
* Du gillar att umgås och hämtar energi i samtalet med kund och kollegor.

**Så jobbar vi**  

Oftast är vi ute hos kund på hel- eller deltid. Vi finner uppdragen tillsammans, och du väljer själv vad som passar dig bäst, ingen lämnas ensam. Vi har daglig kontakt och träffas regelbundet på kontoret som ligger på Vasagatan, där vi bygger gemenskap genom möten, resor och givande erfarenhetsutbyten.


**Statements**

*“Jag är förvånad över hur stark samhörigheten blev. Vi är alla konsulter, men eftersom vi ses ofta och reser ihop lär man känna varandra på riktigt.”* – qbox-konsult

*“Det finns liksom inget bullshit. Det jag fick höra på första träffen är också verkligheten – och det märks hos alla mina kollegor.”* – qbox-konsult

**Kontakt & Ansökan**  

I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Aliby - The Pink Company.  

Då intervjuer och urval sker löpande ber vi dig att inte vänta med din ansökan.
  

Känner du att det här träffar dig – eller någon du känner?
  

Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Lina Melén på lina.melen@aliby.se, 0707 275 568.

title: Mechanical Plant Design Engineer
description:
**Location:**

Ludvika, Dalarna County, Sweden
**Job ID:**

R0088056
**Date Posted:**

2025-04-16
**Company Name:**

HITACHI ENERGY SWEDEN AB
**Profession (Job Category):**

Engineering & Science
**Job Schedule:**

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

**The opportunity**

The Mechanical Plant Design team, part of HVDC, is now looking for a Mechanical Plant Design Engineer to join. You are welcome into our energetic team with mix of experienced and young engineers and colleagues from diverse nationalities around the world. We work closely within the various design teams and collaborate with engineering and research teams in Sweden and abroad.


*"Our team is highly supportive and excels at sharing knowledge. We are looking for someone who can further strengthen this cooperative spirit, so if you thrive in a collaborative environment and value teamwork, this could be the perfect opportunity for you."* - Hiring Manager Daniel Granat


**How you’ll make an impact**

* Evaluate, select and apply standard techniques and procedures to perform station layout design in 3D modelling in parts and assemblies. 2D drafting for drawings and layouts and make sure they are delivered on time and meet quality and safety standards.
* Correctly use design principles, guidelines and applicable standards that are used within mechanical plant design of HVDC stations, onshore and offshore.
* Prepare and propose/present for example bill of materials, estimated engineering hours, general project documentation.
* Interact with customers, suppliers, contractors and internal departments to achieve the scope of deliveries.

**Your background**

* A Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or related discipline.
* Knowledge in 3D-Modeling and preforming 2D-drawings/layouts in Software tools NX/TC.
* Some years of experience in the field.
* A high level of self-motivation, curiosity and desire to learn about new Technologies.
* A collaborative, solutions-oriented approach and strong communication skills.
* Proficiency in English is required, knowledge in Swedish is a great advantage.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement.
* Flexible working time.
* Health care and wellness allowance.
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally.
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase.
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development.
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden.
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave.
Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks.  
* 

**More about Us**

The preferred location for the role is Ludvika and requires frequent presence at our office, especially in the first 6 months. We also have offices in other locations in Sweden where it’s possible to work from after the initial 6 months.  



Are you ready for an exciting new challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Welcome to apply! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis so don’t delay – apply today!  



Recruiting Manager Daniel Granat, daniel.granat@hitachienergy.com will answer your questions about the position. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Nicole Bergman, nicole.bergman@hitachienergy.com


Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer; Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 25 73; Ledarna: Christer Fridlund, +46 107-38 29 12; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85.


**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**

title: Senior Java Backend Developers
description:
**We aren’t just programmers – we are developers!**
 At Telenor, great code matters, but what truly defines us is how we collaborate and challenge each other to grow. Our culture is built on the Challenger mentality: being proactive, setting colleagues up for success, and stepping outside formal roles when needed – because we know our very best work happens when we create together. We believe that all our employees have the mandate and the right information to make the best decisions in their daily work. Are you looking for a workplace where you can make a difference in what matters most – relationships between people? Then you are welcome to Telenor.
   

  

**About The Team**
 We are now looking for several Senior Java Backend Developers to join our Consumer IT team. Here you’ll work with modern technology – our legacy isn’t older than 3–5 years – giving you great learning opportunities and the chance to make an impact. You’ll be part of a positive, welcoming, and supportive team culture based in Råsunda, Solna. We’re in the office Mondays to Wednesdays, with the flexibility of working remotely two days a week.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 In this position you will be building scalable, high performing services and API’s that power our digital platforms. You will be part of transforming our current “modern-but-aging” systems into even newer, cloud-native, event-driven solutions that enable faster and more reliable experiences for our users. Being part of a DevOps team, you will also ensure that our applications are accessible, secure, and deliver exceptional quality and performance.
   

  

**What You’ll Bring**
 Here is a list of our tech to give you an idea of what we work with, and what we expect you to be familiar with:
   

  

* Deep knowledge of Java 11/17+ (Streams, Records, Functional APIs, concurrency, performance tuning)
* Strong skills in Spring Boot 3.x / Spring 6.x and REST API design & implementation
* Solid foundation in OOP, design patterns, and clean code principles
* Hands-on experience with testing frameworks (JUnit 5, Mockito) and a TDD mindset
* Expertise in databases (Oracle SQL) with performance optimization, joins, and indexing
* Familiarity with messaging systems like RabbitMQ and third-party API integrations
* Experience designing and delivering scalable microservices architectures
* Competence with AWS (EC2, S3, RDS, IAM), Kubernetes, and modern CI/CD pipelines
* Strong understanding of logging, monitoring, and observability practices


**Nice to have:** 
 Kafka, caching (Redis/Hazelcast), advanced Kubernetes (EKS, Helm), event-driven design, ELK/Splunk, Resilience4j, and security best practices (OAuth/JWT, OWASP Top 10).
   

  

**Apply today!** 
  

  

 Will you take the next step in your career with us? We look forward to your application! We review applicants on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait—reach out today.  Last application date: 7th of October 2025.
   

  

 If you have any questions or want to know more, feel free to contact the hiring manager Jakob Grefbäck at jakob.grefback@telenor.se Please note that we cannot accept applications via email.
   

  

**Our promise to you** 
  

  

**We are better together.** 
  

  

 Here, you’ll be part of a family-like and inclusive culture, built on strong shared values and leadership that empowers you with both trust and confidence. We believe in enabling each other to act and make decisions, while always having each other’s backs through ups and downs.
   

  

**We support relationships and societies.** 
  

  

 Telenor plays a vital role in the society, giving your work a greater purpose. Every day, we create value for millions of people and maintain a customer-first approach where human relationships are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**We make room for life.** 
  

  

 Work from home up to two days a week, if your role allows it. The rest of the time, we create magic together at the office. You also get two ‘give-me-a-break’ days per year for extra time off, and our flexible working hours help you balance your time. We support you through every stage of life with our benefit package, including collective agreements, occupational pensions, wellness allowances, and customized insurance solutions tailored to your needs.
   

  

**We invite you to a career in motion.** 
  

  

 Your development is at the center of our culture. We dedicate at least 40 hours per year for you to deepen your expertise, explore new areas, and develop in your role. Through Telenor Academy and other learning initiatives, you’ll have the tools and freedom to advance your career. If you want to broaden your horizons, we are present throughout the Nordics.
   

  

**Good to know** 
  

  

 As part of Telenor’s policy, we conduct background checks on final candidates for all recruitments.
   

  

 Looking for a workplace for the future? A workplace where you own your career and you can make the most of your expertise and opportunities. Where you can contribute to technical innovations that we can barely imagine today, but we know will change the map of how people communicate with each other and live their connected lives. Are you looking for a workplace where what happens between people makes all the difference? Then you are welcome at Telenor.

title: Test Developer - Software Quality Assurance of TRATON Future Powertrains
description:
TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation - Let´s make a difference together. Find out more: www.traton.com
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 This role is a part of TRATON Group R&D, located in Södertälje, Sweden.
   

  

 Are you passionate about quality and innovation? As a Test Developer in Software Quality Assurance, you’ll play a key role in shaping the future of TRATON’s award-winning powertrains – both electric and conventional. Working in an agile team, you will help ensure our software meets the highest standards and exceeds customer expectations. Join us and be part of developing world-class solutions in a collaborative, forward-thinking environment.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Analyze requirements and develop test cases and scripts (Python) for new functionalities
* Perform verification in both vehicles and simulated environments
* Plan and coordinate test activities within agile sprints
* Collaborate closely with function developers to secure software quality
* Work according to the SAFe agile framework
* Ensure the software integrates well with vehicle systems and meets customer needs


**Who You Are**
 You are a solution-oriented individual with a passion for technology and teamwork. With a background in programming and software development, you are quick to grasp complex systems and enjoy finding creative solutions together with your colleagues. Your communication skills help you collaborate across disciplines and build strong working relationships. Experience with vehicle systems or powertrain components is a plus. You hold a relevant university degree, a European driver’s license, and you are fluent in English, both spoken and written. Swedish language skills are an advantage.
   

  

 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experiences and perspectives are valuable to us.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 We are a committed team working to ensure the quality of TRATON’s and its brands' future powertrains—both electric and conventional. Our strength lies in the close collaboration between function developers and QA engineers, all driven by a strong customer focus. We value agile principles and believe in cross-functional teamwork, where everyone’s input makes a difference. By joining us, you’ll contribute to TRATON’s role as an industry expert and a leader in driving the shift toward a sustainable transport system.
   

  

**TRATON offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally. Benefits include wellness allowance, bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also host events for employees and their families. Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job Express buses for an easy commute to Södertälje.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes. Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-09-23. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact Arvid Isaksson, Unit Manager Motion Control Testing at arvid.isaksson@scania.com or 08-553 89538.
   

  

 This recruitment process is handled by Scania for TRATON Group R&D.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Fullstack AI Engineer
description:
Fullstack Engineer
 
 📍 Stockholm, Sweden
 



 💼 Full time
 


 About the Role
 
 We’re looking for a Fullstack Engineer to join our Stockholm team. You’ll be part of a small, ambitious group working on applications end-to-end, from frontend, backend, pipelines and model development to deployment in cloud environments.
 



 Most of what we build integrates AI technologies in some way, whether that’s embedding machine learning models, leveraging large language models, or building systems around state-of-the-art AI tools.
 



 This is a great role if you want to grow your skills across the stack while working hands-on with modern tech in real production environments.
 



  




 Responsibilities
 
 Your work would include:
 


* Frontend: Develop frontends with TypeScript/React (or similar frameworks)
* Backend: Build backends in Python (or similar languages)
* Cloud: Deploy applications in GCP, AWS, or Azure
* AI Integration: Work on applications that integrate AI models and services
* Full Lifecycle: Contribute to the full lifecycle: design, coding, testing, deployment, monitoring
* Collaboration: Collaborate closely with clients and internal teams to ensure project success



  




 Background and Skills
 
 We’re open to a wide range of backgrounds but here’s what we’re looking for in an ideal candidate:
 


* Some experience with frontend development (React, TypeScript, or similar)
* Some experience with backend development (Python or similar)
* Comfortable working in cloud environments (e.g., GCP, AWS, Azure)
* Practical experience in software engineering, including version control, testing, and CI/CD
* Strong interest in AI powered applications and learning more about them
* Have a collaborative mindset and willingness to take ownership of your work
* Motivated, curious, and passionate about technology, with strong communication skills
* Professional proficiency in Swedish and English



  





*Please note that you must have permission to work in Sweden, we will not sponsor any work visas at this time*




  




 About Us
 
 We are a modern AI consultancy firm originally founded in Malmö, Sweden. Recently, we’ve expanded to Stockholm, where we’re building a small but ambitious team of machine learning and software engineers.
 


* At our Stockholm office, you’ll find a high degree of autonomy, flexibility, and influence. We want your voice not only in code reviews and architecture discussions, but in shaping what our company becomes, from the types of clients we work with to how we grow our local presence.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
*We're at a pivotal moment for both Tibber and the planet. When joining Tibber, you won’t just help scale a forward-thinking tech company – you’ll contribute to a real shift in how people consume electricity. With millions of smart devices connected to the Tibber platform (like electric vehicles and smart thermostats), we have one of the most unique portfolios trading energy on the market* 
 . We’re looking for an Analytics Engineer to join us in making the energy transition happen – maybe that’s you?
   

  

**Job Mission 🚀**
 In the
 **Data Team at Tibber** 
 , you’ll play a crucial role in shaping how data is modeled, structured, and made accessible for business and analytical use. We are a group of
 **data engineers, analytics engineers, and data scientists,** 
 working together to
 **turn raw data into actionable insights** 
 that drive smarter energy decisions for our customers.
   

  

 As an
 **Analytics Engineer** 
 , you’ll be a core enabler of our data-driven business, ensuring that data is
 **well-modeled, reliable, and easy to use** 
 across the company. You’ll own the
 **semantic layer** 
 and be responsible for
 **transforming raw data into well-defined, trusted datasets** 
 that service both downstream customer-facing applications as well as empower our business teams.
   

  

****What you'll do ✅****
**Model & Transform Data** 
 – Design, build, and maintain curated, analytics-ready datasets using dbt, optimized for both analytical reporting and machine learning applications.
   

  

**Create & Maintain the Semantic Layer** 
 – Define business-friendly tables, metrics, and dimensions that serve as the foundation for reliable decision-making.
   

  

**Optimize for Self-Service Analytics** 
 – Ensure that stakeholders can easily find, understand, and trust the data they need, reducing reliance on ad-hoc requests.
   

  

**Collaborate with Data & Business Teams** 
 – Work closely with data analysts, data scientists, and business stakeholders to understand data needs and improve accessibility.
   

  

**Ensure Data Quality & Trust** 
 – Implement data validation, monitoring, and governance practices to reduce inconsistencies and improve data reliability.
   

  

**Refine & Standardize Data Practices** 
 – Define best practices for data modeling, documentation, and transformation logic, ensuring a scalable and maintainable data ecosystem.
   

  

****What we're looking for⚡****
**Passion for the Power of Data.** 
 You love data that is reliable and accessible because you understand that data is the lifeblood of an organization. You care about
 **data governance, documentation, and quality** 
 , ensuring that data is trustworthy and easy-to-use across Tibber.
   

  

**Data Modeling & Transformation Expertise.** 
 3+ years of experience designing
 **clean, reusable data models** 
 and transformation logic, ideally with
 **dbt.**
**SQL Mastery.** 
 Strong ability to write
 **optimized, scalable SQL** 
 for data transformation, performance tuning, and complex analytical queries.
   

  

**Analytics Enablement.** 
 Experience
 **designing, structuring, and optimizing datasets** 
 to support
 **downstream applications** 
 as well as BI tools like
 **ThoughtSpot or similar platforms**
**Collaboration & Communication.** 
 Ability to
 **bridge the gap between data engineering and analytics** 
 , working cross-functionally to align on data definitions and improve accessibility
   

  

**Version Control & CI/CD.** 
 Familiarity with
 **Git-based workflows and CI/CD pipelines** 
 for managing transformations and data models efficiently.
   

  

**The Tibber Mindset 💆🏻‍♀️💆🏽‍♂️**
 Tibber is not your typical energy supplier. Our tech helps hundreds of thousands of households lower and shift their energy consumption to more sustainable hours. We’re here to accelerate the energy transition – not in theory, but in everyday life.
   

  

 Being on a mission to change an industry as we do fundamentally also means being prepared for the unexpected. We do what others say can’t be done, try and fail together but never lose sight of our users. We work passionately with sustainability and a circular approach, both with our own products and in the entire ecosystem that is affected by everything we do.
   

  

 Starting out with two passionate founders in 2016, we're now 300+ people working for Tibber in our offices in Stockholm, Førde, Berlin, Amsterdam, Oslo, and Helsinki. We will continue to grow within our markets, and we are thrilled to be backed by investors like Balderton Capital, Eight Roads Ventures, Founders Fund, Summa, and Schibsted.
   

  

*At Tibber, we are committed to hiring, developing, and retaining exceptional people regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, or gender identity. We strongly encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply.*
 Tibber is a different company in a very traditional industry. We are aiming to create the best digital tool so that you as a user can apply new technologies to reduce energy consumption and power costs.

title: Embedded Developer
description:
At Sii Sweden we partner with some of the most forward-thinking companies across industries such as automotive, healthcare, life-science and banking.
   

  

 As an Embedded Software Developer at Sii, you won’t just write code—you’ll contribute to the success of diverse, high-impact projects that demand both deep technical knowledge and creative problem-solving; you’ll play a key role in delivering tailored solutions that meet client’s unique requirements.
   

  

 Joining us means working in a collaborative, consultancy-driven environment so If you're excited by challenge, and the opportunity to grow alongside some of the best engineers in the field, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

****Your tasks****
* Design and implement software architecture for embedded systems
* Develop robust applications using C++ and Qt/QML for device interfaces and control logic
* Work on hardware-related programming, including device drivers
* Design, build, and debug embedded Linux environments (GNU/Linux) for various hardware platforms
* Write scripts and tools in Python (or equivalent) to support development, testing, and automation
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, QA, and UX designers
* Contribute to design reviews, documentation, and system integration activities


**Requirements**
* Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or similar
* Solid experience with C++ in embedded system environments
* Strong knowledge of Qt/QML for UI and application layer development
* Experience with GNU/Linux system development and configuration
* Hands-on knowledge of hardware-level programming
* Familiarity with scripting in Python or a similar language
* Proficiency in embedded systems architecture and real-time constraints
* Ability to debug complex software/hardware interactions


 Job no. 250909-CD0I6
   

  

**Benefits For You**
 Solid financial situation
   

  

 Many experts you can learn from
   

  

 Contracts with the biggest brands
   

  

 Refferals program
   

  

 Mentoring program
   

  

 14 authentic core values
   

  

 Inclusive culture based on dialogue
   

  

 Regular integration events and trips
   

  

 Passion Sponsorship Program
   

  

 Open and accessible management team
   

  

 Profit sharing
   

  

 Welcome packs & occasional gifts
